node.description: A sturdy vault, set in the back wall, stands ready for your use. The floor is covered by a soft thick carpet of deep red, and the walls are paneled in polished golden pine. Looking at the back wall, you notice a tiny gap between it and the rest of the room.

node.name: Meek's Stitchery
node.description: Piles of fabric and cloth lie in cluttered heaps about the room, all but hiding the small store's owner. Curled like a frightened kitten on a stool and working diligently at her mending, Meek appears to either not notice or not care who enters and who exits. Shirts, skirts, jackets, and articles of clothing of all types hang behind her on a rack.

node.name: Avlea's Bows, The Straight and Arrow
node.description: A light dusting of wood shavings coats the floor where the Elves who work in this shop have left behind the remnants of their handiwork. Seated on a stool and bracing a bow against her knees as she carves away at it is Avlea, the bowyer who owns this shop. Various quivers, arrows, crossbows, darts, and bows hang off the walls -- the only fixed objects in the shop that are not covered with some form of dust.

node.name: Greenwalls Tower, Arrow Range
node.description: As you look about, you wonder for a moment just what the lunatics out at the far end of the field are doing just standing there while apprentice Rangers shoot arrows at them, until you realize that this is Shard's idea of agility training. You do note to only minor relief that the bows in use appear to be lightly strung, the arrow tips padded against severe puncture damage.

node.name: MAMAS Company, Shard Branch
node.description: Shard's assay shop is filled with the smell of new wood and plaster. Builders move in and out, hurrying to get the place finished, while the assay clerk stands behind a counter in the midst of the clutter and confusion, quietly working away.

node.name: Shard, First Bank of Ilithi
node.description: Creamy white walls and floors surmounted by a dome-shaped ceiling forms the bank of Shard. Streaks of black and silver run through the natural marble used in the structure, and short halls branch off to the north and east.

node.name: First Bank of Ilithi, Coin Exchange
node.description: The walls of this relatively small alcove rise up in a smooth, rounded arch of glossy white marble. A friendly-looking Elven man stands behind a desk with fifteen small drawers in it, taking coins and exchanging them for the local currency.

node.name: First Bank of Ilithi, Teller's Windows
node.description: Polished walnut windows and paneling separate the customers from the tellers and vault against the back of the wall. Several young and pretty Elothean men and women stand behind bars of an anlora-avtoma and steel alloy to process transactions. A gleaming brass sign is embedded into the west wall, stating the bank's policies.

node.name: First Bank of Ilithi, Exchange Vault
node.description: Leather-clad guards stand at attention on each side of the polished blue marble arch which frames the moongate. Behind them, out of reach of the portal, a slender fair-haired Elothean woman reclines on a comfortable high-backed chair. Her richly embroidered scarlet silk robes almost conceal the gilded chains which fasten her ankles to iron rings in the floor. A steady stream of bank employees and favored customers enter and exit the vault all day to process transactions with other banks.

node.name: Shard Tunnels
node.description: Brick arches support the foundation of the street overhead, where a barred sewer grate provides easy access to the surface. Reeking piles of rancid produce have been dumped here by the bazaar vendors above, and the stench discourages any curious surface dwellers from paying this area too close attention. The sewer tunnel slopes steeply downwards to the southeast.

node.name: Silena's Curio Tent
node.description: The clutter that occupies most of this tent would seem to make it impossible for movement, save that it all has a strange, almost catlike quality that causes it to move aside to allow just enough room to navigate through. The proprietor -- Silena Wilderant -- sits at the back of the tent in a cross-legged meditative position, one eye cracked as she watches her business with a snicker and a grin for baffled newcomers.

node.name: House of the Silver Star, Inside the Gate
node.description: Low lanterns flanking a stone walkway illuminate the path from the street to a towering black marble building. Further around the grounds, the pools of light shift and move around a variety of ornamental foliage. Perched on the roof high above, the vague outline of twin gargoyles can be seen.

Smooth grey stone forms a walkway from the street to the entrance of a towering black marble building. Expansive grounds stretch around it, neatly manicured grass bearing a variety of flowering shrubs and graceful trees. High above, twin faces of snarling gargoyle sculptures glare down from the roof.

node.name: House of the Silver Star, Gardens
node.description: Darting around and through the ornamental shrubs which dot the grounds, enchanted orbs of silvery light cause odd, shifting shadows amidst the fyearikil agani trees. Rising behind them is a tall cut stone wall which stretches out in either direction.

Ornamental shrubs in fanciful shapes dot the manicured landscape within the cut stone walls of the House proper, many representing the constellations of the heavens. Rumor has it that they shift places as the seasons progress to mimic the skies above, though it is difficult to tell with the transient nature of the leafy fyearikil agani.

node.name: House of the Silver Star, Pond
node.description: Glistening in the evening light, a small pond surrounded by green reeds occupies this corner of the House grounds. Reflected in the sparkling waters of the crystal-clear pond is a majestic willow tree, its fragrant branches dangling low and filling the air with a fresh scent. Clusters of water lilies float lazily about on the water, always managing to stay just out of reach.

Shining in the sunlight, a small pond surrounded by green reeds occupies this corner of the House grounds. Reflected in the sparkling waters of the crystal-clear pond is a majestic willow tree, its fragrant branches dangling low and filling the air with a fresh scent. Clusters of water lilies float lazily about on the water, always managing to stay just out of reach.

node.name: House of the Silver Star, Gardens
node.description: White beeswax candles flicker with pale light, encircling a glassy obsidian fountain. The natural flow and warp of the stone cause odd reflections in the water before it spills into the basin below. Ringing the crushed marble gravel surrounding the fountain is an abundant moon garden that fills the air with a strong, sweet fragrance. A window of the building is barely visible in the darkness.

Clear water flows from a glassy obsidian fountain, spilling across its smooth surface and into the wide basin below with muted splashes. Leafy green plants grow all around the crushed marble gravel surrounding the fountain, leaving barely enough room to see one of the building's windows.

node.name: House of the Silver Star, Entryway
node.note: House of the Silver Star|Silver Star
node.description: Gilded inlay stretches across the polished black marble floor of the foyer, forming the crest of the House of the Silver Star. Crystal candelabra light the spacious hall, the acoustics of the vaulted ceiling oddly muffling all sounds coming from the rest of the area. A gleaming mahogany desk rests just to one side of the doorway, a sign perched on it directing visitors seeking to register with the House to the east.

node.name: House of the Silver Star, Sitting Room
node.description: Gazing down from the walls are portraits of prominent House members past, the glow from the large fireplace reflected on their gilded frames. Rich red curtains are open to reveal a view of the manicured grounds outside, and plush black velvet furniture is clustered atop a jewel-toned raw silk woven rug.

node.name: House of the Silver Star, Scribe Office
node.description: Dim light from outside streams in through the glass windows whose thick red brocade curtains hang open to reveal the shadowy visage of a massive willow tree outside. Lit by floral-themed stained glass lamps, an ironwood-edged mahogany desk covered with official-looking documents and lineage charts dominates the richly appointed room. A plush blue armchair sits to one side.

Sunlight streams in through the glass windows whose thick red brocade curtains hang open to reveal a view of a massive willow tree outside. An ironwood-edged mahogany desk covered with official-looking documents and lineage charts dominates the richly appointed room, and a plush blue armchair is pulled away from it for guests.

node.name: Aelik's Pawn
node.description: The deceiving appearance of this shop's broken down and dreary outside is nothing compared to the clean and carefully organized inside. While a fine layer of dust does seem to coat some of the older items, there is a feeling of constant change here as things are shuffled about, sold, or moved off to other locations.

node.name: Aelik's Pawn, Backroom
node.description: Shelves line the walls, side-by-side with cabinets that hold various oddities and objects that will not fit in the front room being shoved in here instead. Clutter covers nearly every inch of bare space, piling up to the ceiling.

arc.move: room look behind cab;look behind cab;climb hidden ladder

node.name: Undershard, Secret Nook
node.description: This cramped nook forms the base of a narrow shaft leading straight up, with a rickety wooden ladder stretching up to a trapdoor far above. The nook itself looks to be a dead end, the ladder balanced against a curving wall of sheet rock.

node.name: Shard, Ruined Building
node.description: Crumbling stone walls sunken into the earth are all that remain to mark this area as the basement of some long abandoned structure. A skeletal framework rises into the sky above, framing the outline of what used to be the first floor. The few surviving beams are blackened and charred.

node.name: Shard Tunnels
node.description: A stream of refuse flows through a rough channel cut into the floor, reeking of sewage and things better left unexplored. A rough-hewn shaft in the ceiling rises toward the surface, spotted with slippery but useable stone handholds. The tunnel continues into the distance to the northwest and slopes upwards slightly to the south.

node.name: Shard, Abandoned Building
node.description: Once inside, it is obvious that this abandoned carriage barn is not as abandoned as other buildings in the neighborhood. Although unpainted, the walls are shored up with sound wooden planking, and the flagstone floor is swept clean. A ladder pokes from an opening in the floor.

node.name: Balint's Tiles
node.description: Behind a faded and unassuming storefront, the tile business of Balint Firkusny appears to be booming. Every inch of wall space is covered with tiles in a variety of colors, sizes and textures. The Elven merchant himself scurries about, pointing to one area, highlighting the details of another under a small oil lamp, and in general making a nuisance of himself to his quiet, dedicated staff.

node.name: Milene's Rose, Stableyard
node.description: The sweet, musty smell of hay links with the aroma of cooking food that comes from the adjacent inn. Grey stones line the little cobblestone court, their surface gleaming despite the darkness, leading up with a gentle twist to the darkness-painted wooden structure of the inn's stable.

The sweet, musty smell of hay mingles with the less appealing ones of sweat and manure to form a complex aroma that is further compounded by the faint scent of cooking food that comes from the adjacent inn. Grey stones line the little cobblestone court, their surfaces slick from a recent scrubbing, leading up with a gentle twist to the red-painted wooden structure of the inn's stable.

node.name: Milene's Rose, Front Desk
node.description: Shadows drift in lazy patterns over the gleaming dark wood that compose the floor and walls, digging into the carvings of roses that gracefully climb in vines over the satiny planks. A black desk serviced by a young man curves out of the east wall. Stairs lead up, a pattern of black roses woven into the blue carpeting that covers them.

Gleaming dark wood compose the floor and walls here, and tiny roses have been carved into the satiny, varnished planks. Warm sunlight streams through the open doorway, alive with the dance of motes of dust. A black desk serviced by a young woman curves out of the east wall. Stairs lead up, a pattern of black roses woven into the blue carpeting that covers them.

node.name: Milene's Rose, Tavern
node.description: Roomy and rectangular, the tavern for Milene's Rose is always busy, but strangely never so full that it becomes unbearably crowded. A booth in the corner allows for privacy, and a bar offers service for the thirsty and the hungry. There is little sign of disarray anywhere.

node.name: Milene's Rose, Back Hallway
node.description: Miniature roses grow in ceramic pots within a shallow bay window at the end of the hallway. The tiny blooms come in all colors, from pale ivories and pinks to deep corals and crimsons. A window bench makes this a cozy corner for friends to sit and chat while enjoying the flowers and relaxing after the rigors of the day.

node.name: Milene's Rose, Back Hallway
node.description: The hallway is redolent of lemons and beeswax, rubbed in and buffed to bring out a soft golden sheen in the rosewood paneling. A large brass pot hangs beneath a half-open skylight, cradling within its confines a s'vraela vine imported from the island of M'Riss. Beads of dew form on the metal surface of the pot, causing it to shimmer slightly with each movement.

node.name: Milene's Rose, Back Hallway
node.description: Quieter than the front hall or rest of the inn, the rooms in this part of the wide corridor are occupied by permanent guests who choose to reside at the Rose. Polished marble-topped mahogany tables hold crystal vases filled with fragrant flowers, and a deep blue carpet runs the length of the hall.

node.name: Milene's Rose, Upstairs Landing
node.description: This short hallway leads to the rooms of the Rose. A strip of blue carpeting runs down the floor, looking fresh and clean. A door of rosewood and a door of silverwillow face each other to the north and south, offering privacy for those who seek it. Stairs lead down to the light and clamor of the tavern proper.

node.name: Milene's Rose, Rose Room
node.description: Black roses edged in silver have been traced over the watered silk used to cover the walls, the faded rose hue of the fabric adding warm color to this spacious room. A window in the south wall is framed by thick silk curtains, and a four-poster rosewood bed framed with bedcurtains of white gossamer is positioned in the center of the room. The sweet scent of the inn's hallmark symbol rests lightly in the air, wafting from a sachet on the bed. A gleaming rosewood door leads back outside.

node.name: Milene's Rose, Silver Room
node.description: Roses are traced in black over the thin silver leaf paper that has been applied to the walls of this spacious room. Windows framed by long curtains of white gauze allow for all the kinds of light to slip through -- softly. A four-poster bed made from a frame of lovingly polished beech wood lies pushed up against the wall, its covers turned down. A hearth framed by grey bricks allows for coziness in the wintertime. Through the silverwillow door in the south wall lies the distant world left behind.

node.name: Scholars' Museum, Rotunda
node.description: The museum entrance is strangely hushed and peaceful after the day's echoing bustle has ended. The massive fossilized skeleton of a war mammoth looms ominously on a low marble pedestal in the center of the room. Shadows cluster in the recesses, while the pale marble of the interior gleams softly in the variable light filtering through the curved crystal panes of the high domed ceiling.

Airy and echoing, the entrance to the Museum is an open and welcoming space ringed with tall gilded columns soaring up to the high domed ceiling. Atop a low marble pedestal, the massive fossilized skeleton of a war mammoth dominates the room. Tall palm trees in carved stone planters raise their fringed leaves, vivid against the pale stone, as light spills in through curving crystal panes to splash across the softly gleaming marble of the walls and other surfaces.

node.name: Scholars' Museum, Salon
node.description: Polished to a warm glow, mahogany paneling and plush floor rugs lend this room an intimate, hushed atmosphere. Oversized armchairs provide a comfortable place to sit and chat, or to attend to visiting lecturers. A carved stone fireplace with a wide mahogany mantel sits opposite floor to ceiling windows that afford a fine view of the tower at the heart of the city. Spaced about the edges of the room are display pedestals and plinths bearing examples of some of the museum's rare and exotic finds.

Opulent red velvet curtains, which can be drawn to preserve the warmth on cold winter nights, reveal through the tall windows an inspiring view of the Great Tower glittering in the reflected light of the stars and moons. Lit tapers in branched candlesticks and a crackling fire in the carved stone fireplace lend a cheering warmth and glow to the salon, as well as the pleasant scent of burning apple wood. Some of the museum's rare and exotic finds are displayed on pedestals around the room.

node.name: Scholars' Museum, Gift Shop
node.description: Long and narrow, this room is paneled in rich, dark mahogany. Plush, patterned rugs cover the cream-and-russet marble floor, and ornate brass lamps support softly glowing gaethzen spheres which shed a warm light on the polished counter.

node.name: Scholars' Museum, Conservatory
node.description: In the darkness the glass walls and arched roof fade into invisibility, leaving the impression of a dim, rustling forest open to the aromatic night air. Drooping leaves dance restlessly, causing shadows to waver in the umbrous light.

Warm and fresh smelling, the conservatory is a mass of thriving foliage. Among the many trees collected here are shining copperleaf, languid birch and graceful rowan, their branches arching overhead to shade the gravel walkway while brilliant firethorn bush and lush stands of enormous fern grow nearer to the ground. Exotic flowering plants flourish next to hardier native species in a harmonious whole, their scents mingling in an exhilarating blend of spice, sweet and astringently herbal aromas.

node.name: Scholars' Museum, Water Garden
node.description: Hushed and silent save for the constant music of trickling water, the stillness of the night wraps this garden in peace. Faint starlight through the glass reflects in the dark waters of the pool, lending a silvery sheen to the quivering surface and gleaming on the closed buds of the water lilies. The trailing branches of the willows rustle softly, sheltering the iris and golden flag beneath its leaves.

Serene and refreshing, this room is a refuge for those seeking a calm retreat. The melodic trickle of water over stone provides a soothing background music broken by an occasional splash as one of the goldfish in the shallow pool leaps in a shining arc. Deep blue iris, tall rushes, narcissus and golden flag are reflected in the shifting waters, and starry white water lilies cover the surface. Slender willows bend to trail long branches in the pool and over the mossy rock.

node.name: Scholars' Museum, Archives
node.description: From floor to ceiling this small, windowless room is lined with sturdy oak bookcases, all of them full and some so crammed that the glass doors cannot be closed. More piles of books and stacked papers cover every surface, tottering in mounds on the seats of chairs, on small side tables and benches, and heaped in unstable pyramids on the flagstone floor itself. The only partially clear space is the surface of the desk in the center of the room and the heavy oak armchair drawn up behind it.

node.name: Scholars' Museum, Gallery
node.description: The glow of gaethzen lamps blocks all view of the night outside, giving the gallery the air of a well-lit stage awaiting the opening curtain. High arched windows reflect the interior like black mirrors, creating a double image which reinforces the sense of unreality. In the soft light, images in the tapestries and paintings lining the walls flicker, and dim shadows cluster about the display cases and pedestals.

Paintings and tapestries line the walls of this spacious room, interspersed with bronze gaethzen wall lamps. Spaced along the lengthy tessellated corridor are display cases and pedestals holding more of the museum's treasures and oddities. High arched windows between columns of creamy veined marble allow light to stream in from the opposite wall while offering a good view of the streetscape outside.

node.name: Mirrors by Noelle
node.description: White drapes balloon from the roof, giving this store the feeling of a tent established by some temporary merchant. Occasionally brushing back the colored drop beads that dangle from her veil, Noelle d'Lorchesse smiles quietly as she displays her mirrored wares to discerning customers. Her visitors are a varied lot, from all across Elanthia, testifying to the Elven glazier's talent and notoriety even at her young age.

node.name: Genevive's Sweet Tooth
node.description: The heavenly scent of baking sweets floats through the air on a gentle breeze coming from the oven in the store's backroom. Metal trays stacked on shelves along the walls hold a wide assortment of finished edibles waiting to be purchased. Genevive, the woman who single-handedly runs the bakery, runs back and forth from the kitchen to the front room, bringing forth the latest delight.

node.name: Hangman's Noose, Vestibule
node.description: True to the tavern's name, a noose of thick knotted rope dangles from a wooden beam just above the doorway. Drunken patrons stagger out the door and into the street, sounds of merriment and music drifting from the common room to the north.

node.name: Hangman's Noose, Common Room
node.description: Crackling torches light this musty room, the air filled with the smells of smoke, roasted meat and strong ale. Tables have been pushed away from the center of the floor to form a makeshift stage for a small band, playing raucous and bawdy shanties on battered instruments. A long bar lines one wall to the west, and a broad table is pushed against the opposite corner.

node.name: Hangman's Noose, Main Bar
node.description: Crossed headsman's axes hang on the fieldstone wall behind the bar, the blades inlaid with carnelian to resemble spatters of blood. To the south, burly patrons cluster about a private table, while the noise from the east makes it easy to identify the location of the common room. A stairway leads up to the second floor.

node.name: Hangman's Noose, Private Table
node.description: Big enough to seat ten or more, this wide round table offers a view of the tavern and its rowdy patrons. Antique instruments of torture have been mounted on the walls in this corner, part of the owner's grisly collection.

node.name: Hangman's Noose, Private Table
node.description: Most of the patrons hesitate to approach this shadowy table, its surface pitted and scarred with axe marks. Rough-looking warriors jostle and laugh with one another here, the crude local argot as thick as the steel weapons that flash at a moment's provocation.

node.name: Hangman's Noose, Backroom
node.description: Several sweating laborers haul a seemingly endless quantity of casks across the floor from a loading dock. They curse and strain as they hoist each one up onto one of many shelves already filled with dozens of casks, each painted a dull black. A massive Gor'Tog overseer flicks a short-handled whip to remind shirkers of their job.

node.name: Houses Consulate, Foyer
node.description: Flecked granite floors partially obscured by faded tapestry rugs have been polished to a high sheen reflecting with a mirror-like quality. High above, four colorful banners dangle from the ceiling, the gentle currents of air sending wave like ripples cascading across their silky surfaces. Several young Elothean scribes dressed in brightly colored robes dash up and down an elaborate stairway, arms tightly wrapped around various parchments, scrolls, and documents.

node.name: Houses Consulate, Steel Dove
node.description: Simple grey woven mats cover the cool stone floor, the hues echoed in the armor neatly arranged on a nearby rack. A long counter runs along one wall, piled high with salvaged swords and shields.

Simple grey woven mats cover the cool stone floor, the hues echoed in the armor neatly arranged on a nearby rack. A long counter runs along one wall, piled high with salvaged swords and shields. Broad-shouldered Elotheans perched on stools gradually scrub them free of rust, smiles on their young faces despite their scars.

node.name: Houses Consulate, Verdant Lily
node.description: Bottles, jars, and assorted vials are scattered along painted white shelves that line the room. Gleaming trays of silver surgical instruments and bundles of herbs have been carefully arranged on four oak tables that are pushed together and covered in unbleached linen cloths.

node.name: Houses Consulate, Silver Star
node.description: Reddish-brown bookshelves line the walls of this expansive room, from which the robust smell of moldy parchment is carried on the gentle currents of air meandering though the area. Quiet scribes sit at elaborately carved desks piled high with dusty tomes, taking note of damaged portions of text.

node.name: Shard, The New South Bridge
node.description: Only the patrons of an inn or a tavern wander the bridge. Some of the habitually nocturnal use the lampposts along the street for support as well as illumination, but unlike the old bridge, here they are in no danger of falling through a hole in the planks and drowning.

There always seems to be a crowd at the city end of the bridge: travelers find it natural to inspect their equipment before braving the wild or tidy their appearance before entering the city. So common is the instinct to pause that if you see someone who doesn't stop, you can bet it's a shopper headed for the stores on the bridge.

node.name: South Bridge, The Dusk Arcade
node.description: The architecture of a brick building to the west -- Coin of the Realm, to judge by the brass plaque beside its entrance -- suggests security rather than style. The small windows on each side of the door are protected with stout iron grilles, and the door, while avoiding a fortress appearance, still looks like it could withstand a very determined attempt to force it.

node.name: South Bridge, The Dusk Arcade
node.description: Exposed black beams contrast boldly with the white plaster walls of a shop to the west. Above the shop's entrance are painted the words Tokens of Affection and a picture of an armored knight kneeling at the feet of a noble lady. Below it, small paned windows to the left and right display ladies' adornments and decorations.

node.name: South Bridge, The Dusk Arcade
node.description: The half-timbered building to the west shows a large sign across its facade, a sign that says simply Little Frills. Beneath it is a shop window full of brightly dressed dolls of every race.

node.name: South Bridge, The Dusk Arcade
node.description: The building to the west is almost a twin to its neighbor to the south: fantastic beasts and the bright tints of heraldry decorate its front, but unlike the painted shields of the other shop, this one displays a lavish array of province, city and guild flags. A painted canvas above the entrance proclaims Blazons and Banners.

node.name: South Bridge, The Dusk Arcade
node.description: A building with an unusual facade stands to the west: its front is covered with shields brightly painted with a host of heraldic blazons. All the beasts one might conceive of -- from drakes to dragons, lions to leopards, and greyhounds to gryphons -- gambol across the front of the shop.

node.name: Shard, The New South Bridge
node.description: To the south, torches light New Gate, the city's stout bulwark against the wilds across the water. Towers rise on each side of the main gate, with its heavy and well-oiled iron portcullis.

To the south, torches light New Gate, the city's stout bulwark against the wilds across the water. The main gate, with its heavy and well-oiled iron portcullis, is flanked by towers, the one to the west part of the granite front of the Theater of Shard.

node.name: South Bridge, The Dawn Arcade
node.description: A two-story shop combines smooth cream-colored plaster walls on street level with a mellow honey-oak siding above it. A red tile roof caps the building and provides a home for a brick chimney and what looks like a stork's nest.

node.name: South Bridge, The Dawn Arcade
node.description: Across the front of the shop to the east runs a frieze of odd-looking animals: round-bodied birds with long beaks, long skinny necks and legs, and little flapping wings. The creatures are painted a rainbow of bright hues, and six objects shaped and colored just like the pictures are spaced along the gutter under the eaves, perhaps serving as rainspouts of some kind.

node.name: South Bridge, The Dawn Arcade
node.description: The shop here presents a gigantic jolly face to the street: a wide red tongue of a threshhold, an oval mouth now closed by a door painted like a toothy grin, and round windows of eyes whose shades are drawn in slumber.

The shop here presents a gigantic jolly face to the street it has a wide red tongue of a threshhold, an oval door open like a laughing mouth under a nose-like red gable, and even round windows on each side for eyes. With an appearance like this, the sound of a tin horn, a music box or a toy drum would hardly seem amiss.

node.name: South Bridge, The Dawn Arcade
node.description: A red-and-white-striped pole advertises Budd's Barber Shop, a modest half-timbered house with a steeply peaked roof. The shop's entrance has gleaming brass hinges and a wide lintel carved with alchemical symbols. Many odors waft from the shop, but the strongest is bay rum.

node.name: South Bridge, The Dawn Arcade
node.description: A two-story building with a shingled front bears a sign reading Curious Cabinetry in bold red letters. The entrance is surrounded by intricately carved doorposts and lintel. A wooden gargoyle leans from a corner of the roof directly above a rain barrel.

node.name: Shard, The New South Bridge
node.description: Few roam the city's streets at night, and given the custom of its merchants to close at sundown, it's not hard to see why. Much of the time, the only voice heard is the cry of the city watch announcing the hour.

A horse's iron-shod hooves ring on the cobblestones, the wooden wheels of a farmer's wagon squeak as they turn, peddlers cry out their wares and children shout at play. And the scene is as varied as the sound: it may be a prince, it may be a beggar, it may be a sentinel, it may be a thief, but there's always an interesting sight on the South Bridge.

node.name: Shard, The New South Bridge
node.description: Under the light from the lampposts, wagons come and go, usually arriving loaded and leaving empty. Many a merchant schedules shipments to arrive at night, when the traffic is light, interruptions are few, and the authorities will not mind if the bridge is blocked for a few minutes.

Street sweepers and pigeons continue their never-ending labor of keeping the street free from rubbish. They're aided by canny merchants who know that a clear walkway and a clean street are good for business.

node.name: Shard, The New South Bridge
node.description: Although many city streets are frighteningly narrow, this grand bridge concourse is broad enough for the heaviest wagons to pass side-by-side. But the bridge can boast of more than its size: with a system of drains and gutters, both the street itself and the houses along it enjoy the most modern sanitation Elanthia can offer.

Although many city streets are so narrow the sunlight never penetrates to the ground, this grand bridge concourse is broad enough for the most gala processions, parades, or pageants to march along with ease. But the bridge can boast of more than its size: with a system of drains and gutters, both the street itself and the houses along it enjoy the most modern sanitation Elanthia can offer.

node.name: Coin of the Realm
node.description: A brass chandelier and matching wall sconces illuminate walls of white plaster and pale oak wainscot in this small, handsome shop. A note and a brace of candles rest on a simple table next to some chairs for customers.

node.name: South Bridge Flats, The Vestibule
node.description: A small vestibule lit by a pewter lamp occupies the space between an ascending flight of stairs and the street door. A thick green carpet on the stairs cushions and quiets the footsteps.

node.name: The Second-Floor Hallway
node.description: The upstairs hall is quiet, with a deep-piled carpet underfoot. The dim light of an oil lamp at the head of the stairs shows half-timber and plaster walls with a window at the street end of the room.

The upstairs hall is quiet, carpeted with the same green rug as the stairs. The walls are half-timbered with mellow oak paneling below cream-colored plaster. The narrow room is lit by a securely fastened window at the street end.

node.name: Curious Cabinetry
node.description: From somewhere nearby come the sounds of adze, plane and hammer and the smells of fine wood and glue but in this room, polished floors and paneled walls are the setting for the cabinetmaker's art. The light from a few candles reflects in the varnished surfaces of skillfully made doors.

node.name: Tokens of Affection
node.description: Set high in the walls are roundels of colored glass that shed patches of light in rose, light blue, ochre, and apple-green over the counters. As the sun moves, the rainbow of circles shifts, casting new shades and highlights on the wares displayed on crystal, platinum, gold, and silver trays.

node.name: South Bridge Flats, The Vestibule
node.description: A small vestibule lit by a pewter lamp occupies the space between an ascending flight of stairs and the street door. A trim canvas strip on the stairs quiets the footsteps but shows what look like chemical stains.

node.name: The Second-Floor Hallway
node.description: The upstairs hall is quiet now that night has come and no patrons visit the shop downstairs. An oil lamp at the head of the stairs lights the dove-grey walls and reflects in the panes of a window at the street end of the room.

At rare intervals, a muffled thud is heard from the barber shop downstairs, as if something heavy had been dropped or something had exploded. It can't be denied that these noises are often accompanied by an odd odor, but the location of these apartments is prime, and the tenants seem to take such events in stride. The hall is at least well lit, with a large window at the street end.

node.name: Budd's Barber Shop
node.description: The room looks like Budd is more interested in keeping shop than in chopping locks. It's filled with odds and ends of merchandise: a crate of tincture jars sits next to a box of candle molds beside a wicker case of clippers and crocks. And that's not counting the stuff on the counter or in the cabinet behind it. At least it has the traditional mirror and barber chair.

node.name: Little Frills
node.description: At the center of the showroom is a miniature festival wagon, its big wheels and high-backed seats gilded and brightly painted. On it sit dolls of the eleven races for sale in the shop. The dolls' clothes and accessories surround the display on a rainbow of colorful counters -- violet, blue, green, yellow, orange, and red.

node.name: South Bridge Flats, The Vestibule
node.description: A small vestibule lit by a pewter lamp occupies the space between an ascending flight of stairs and the street door. A soft, deep purple carpet with gold edges covers the stairs.

node.name: The Second-Floor Hallway
node.description: The walls of the upstairs hall are covered with cream paper hand-painted in tones of green and gold with scenes of woodland and meadow. Two bronze lamps light the hall, and a big window graces the street end.

The walls of the upstairs hall are covered with cream paper hand-painted in tones of green and gold with scenes of woodland and meadow. A big window overlooks the street and lights the room, and two bronze lamps come in handy on cloudy days.

node.name: The Toy Box
node.description: No merry-go-round at a circus could be cheerier than the decor of this shop: bright calliope music plays from somewhere behind gilded and painted screens. In place of counters, the merchandise rests on the tray-like backs of carousel animals suspended on shining brass poles: a snarling lion, a black stallion, a polar bear, and a woolly ram parade their wares. A carriage drawn by unicorns is provided for patrons who need a rest from their shopping.

node.name: Blazons and Banners
node.description: The shop is crowded with bales of fabric in every color, cutting tables, tailor's dummies, and all the tools for fine needlework. Cases hold tabards and flags in abundance, and near the street door, the seamstress Zezinka sits behind a wooden counter with a catalog listing the shop's stock in trade.

node.name: The Heraldry Shop
node.description: A palette of smells greets patrons of the Heraldry Shop as mineral spirits, turpentine, and linseed oil compete for olfactory attention. But Bonime, the artist, allows no visual clutter: rows of paints and solvents, pots of brushes, and sketches on scraps of paper all occupy orderly places on walls and workbenches. A leather-bound catalog rests on a plain plank counter at the front of the shop.

node.name: South Bridge Flats, The Vestibule
node.description: A small vestibule lit by a pewter lamp occupies the space between an ascending flight of stairs and the street door. A rag rug at the bottom of the stairs has been provided for visitors to wipe their feet on.

node.name: The Second-Floor Hallway
node.description: The upstairs hall has a pleasingly fresh scent of wax and soap and polish. A lamp shaped like a shield lights the room, and its rays are reflected in the window at the street end.

The upstairs hall is scrubbed and dusted, the hardwood floor is recently waxed and freshly swept, and the window at the end of the room is sparkling clean. A polished oil lamp shaped like a shield lights the stairs.

node.name: Bettin' Birdies, The Anteroom
node.description: An ornate red, black and yellow carpet graces the entrance to Ashoo's Casino, where hopeful (and dismayed) gamblers pass in and out, blessing their joys or cursing their woes. Occasional cheers or moans escape from the top of a sweeping staircase that leads to the betting room.

node.name: Bettin' Birdies, The Casino
node.description: A perch-like metal rod extends completely across a room hung with yellow drapes. On the perch stand three contraptions of wood and metal that resemble huge (if skinny) canaries. In their metal feet they grip the rod, which serves as the axle around which they rotate, spinning and flapping their mechanical wings.

node.name: Elanthian Travel Tours, Gift Shop
node.description: A crystal chandelier, hanging in the center of the room, tinkles softly in the breeze from the open door. Built to scale, a panorama of the city of Shard is encased in a glass display in the center of the room. Trinkets are strategically located to show them at their best on each tower. A heavily burdened table and stand huddle in opposite corners of the room.

node.name: The New Bridge, West Tower
node.description: A stone-paved walkway extends above the South Gate to the east and to the roof of the theater to the west. The tower commands a wide and far-reaching view down the road and beyond to the dark sweep of the Whistling Wood.

node.name: The New Bridge, East Tower
node.description: High above the South Gate, embrasures pierce the stone battlements between the merlons that give cover to the defenders of the walls. The perch commands the main entrance to the city with a field of fire that covers the approaches to the New South Bridge.

node.name: Shoan a Sidelkuloa, Outdoor Seating
node.description: Numerous rows of seats wait here for use during theatrical performances on the outdoor stage. The wall's stonework extends upwards far enough to keep unattentive patrons from falling over the edge to a rather uncomfortable demise.

node.name: Old Ilithi Trade Route, Journey's Rest
node.description: Like a bulwark against chaos, the gatehouse wall of Shard rises to the north. Its granite blocks enclose the New South Gate that guards the bridge leading to the city. The Old Ilithi Trade Route wends southward, a road haunted by the nightmare memory of the Dark Hand.

node.name: Tower of Honor, Entryway
node.description: The broad, half-moon shaped entryway to the Paladin's Guild of Shard is made of the same creamy white marble substance that composes its exterior. Veins of silver flash along the floor and sides, gliding around the doorway like fixed streaks of power. Stairs carved out of the west wall ascend to the next brightly lit level. To the north and through an arch cut in the wall that divides the entryway from the second half of the tower's base, is the office for the Shard guildleader.

node.name: Tower of Honor, Forge Tunnel
node.description: Sitting at the bottom of the long stone stairway that leads up to the Tower of Honor, this narrow hall holds no adornment. The surrounding rock of the walls and ceiling has been expertly excavated, its surface smooth to the touch. Well-placed torches generate some light, enough to see the way by.

node.name: Tower of Honor, Forge Tunnel
node.description: Sitting at the bottom of the long stone stairway that leads up to the forge, this narrow hall holds no adornment. The surrounding rock of the walls and ceiling has been expertly excavated, its surface smooth to the touch. Well-placed torches generate some light, enough to see the way by.

node.name: Tower of Honor, Library Level
node.description: This room is but a small, semi-circular alcove with a doorway in the east side leading into the library of the paladins. A set of stairs -- chiseled out of the white stone of the tower -- are located directly across from the doorway, climbing up one way, down the other.

node.name: Tower of Honor, Squire's Level
node.description: A doorway in the east side of this crescent-shaped alcove grants access to the barracks of the younger members of the Paladin's guild, also called the Squire's Quarters. A guard by the oaken door entryway monitors those who arrive and exit, and stairs on the wall across from her lead up toward the senior Paladins' quarters and training floor, and down toward the library and the entry level.

node.name: Tower of Honor, Knight's Level
node.description: The ends of this small alcove have been hung with banners dyed in the gold and blue colors of the Paladins of Shard. A door of good steel in the east wall is watched over by a guard and a flight of stairs on the wall across from him lead up to the Justiciars' quarters and the training floor, and down toward still more quarters and the entry level.

node.name: Tower of Honor, Justiciar's Level
node.description: Bas-relief murals of blue lapis and goldstone have been set at either ends of this alcove in honor of those who have reached this level of excellence in the guild. A door made of the same creamy white marble that composes the rest of the tower leads into the finest of the barracks, flanked at all times by two Paladins dressed in shining silvery plate. Stairs lead up to the training floor, and back down to the lower quarters and the entryway.

node.name: Paladins' Guild, Justiciar's Study
node.description: The office of the Justiciar is plain, balancing on the knife edge between spartan and severe. Nothing but a clean whitewash adorns the walls, except for the east one which has a single red dot painted on it, oddly enough. A simple desk of uncarved wood is pushed up against the back, the papers on its surface in neat, regimented order.

node.name: Tower of Honor, Training Room
node.description: Racks of weaponry line all four walls, an impressive array gleaming from the shelves. Everything from wooden practice staves to polished steel broadswords are available for use. Padded mats on the floor help to prevent injury if students become over-eager.

node.name: Tower of Honor, Chapel
node.description: An exquisitely carved ivory statue is the centerpiece of this small chapel. Representing Chadatru, the traditionally honored god of Paladins, the statue dominates the area with its presence. Brilliantly colored stained glass windows cast multihued shadows over the wooden pews radiating outward from Chadatru's icon.

node.name: Tower of Honor, Library
node.description: The soft scent of sandalwood fills the air from the aromatic woods that have been used to make the shelves in the guild's library. Not a speck of dust can be detected anywhere in the room, possibly due to the fact that the cleaning of this place is a primary chore of the younger initiates of the guild. Curtains of heavy blue velvet gathered by gold cord frame stained glass windows that have been set in the four cardinal points of the circular walls.

node.name: Tower of Honor, Orb Room
node.description: Cold stone walls crowd close in this cramped chamber. The room is barren save for a beautifully crafted soulstone orb mounted on a brass tripod, standing directly in the center of the alcove.

node.name: Tower of Honor, Guildleader's Office
node.description: Flanked by long tapestries of gold and blue, the guildleader's office is at once magnificent and sparse. Illumination from crystal globes throws off a cool, silvery radiance, their placement and subsequent lighting automatically draws attention toward the polished white ironwood desk at the far back and center of the chamber. A sense of pride and accomplishment infuses itself into the very air. This is, indeed, the heart of the protectors of Ilithi.

node.name: Miglo's Forge, Supplies
node.description: The temperature in this deceptively small building is quite warm, and a faint metallic odor hangs in the air. A frazzled Dwarven attendant busily dusts every surface he can reach, including a heavy leather flap that is designed to muffle clangs of metal from below. Within a darkened arch on the west wall, a glimpse of stairs leading down into blackness can be seen.

node.name: Liani's Heaven, Entrance
node.description: The sound of laughter and gossip fills the air, mingling with the scent of pipe smoke and baking tarts. A warm golden glow fills the room, coming from the north and the famous tavern of Liani's Heaven. Pegs line the walls as places to hang cloaks and hats.

node.name: Liani's Heaven, Taproom
node.description: The golden glow of the polished walls is brightened by the fire of a hearth in the north wall. Slow eddies of curling smoke twist into convoluted shapes as Elven elders and Halfling greybeards alike sit and smoke pipes, discussing the parts of life that yet remain a mystery, with tankards of ale before them to help make things more profound.

node.name: Liani's Heaven, Taproom
node.description: Light shimmers off the honey-colored wood that composes the low-roofed but expansive taproom of Liani's Heaven. A bar curves from one end of the tavern to the other, its surface polished to a high gleam by tankards and plates slung down its surface by the Halflings behind the bar.

node.name: Liani's Heaven, Quiet Booth
node.description: A dark amber tabletop with heavy nicks and scoring occupies most of the booth. A single lantern hangs overhead, throwing a pool of illumination over the padded benches provided for the comfort of the patrons who want a little peace and quiet to discuss business affairs best left to private places.

node.name: Liani's Heaven, Private Table
node.description: A holdover from a time when wearing the symbol of the Bard's Guild was a death sentence and secrecy was necessary, this private table has now become a permanent fixture of the tavern as a reminder of those times. Scrolls are laid out on the table, the elegant mark of a skilled calligrapher across their surface.

node.name: Liani's Heaven, Barman's Area
node.description: The service area of the bar is a hive of Halfling activity. Dishwashers, ragmen, sweepers, and servers stream in and out of the bar's pass-through, all under the watchful eyes of the tavern bouncers.

node.name: Liani's Heaven, Small Room
node.description: Several musical instruments are carefully laid out on a low, felt-covered table. An ancient grandmotherly Halfling woman glances up whenever anyone enters, and her gnarled fingers lovingly grasp a carved ivory flute.

node.name: Undershard, Squatters' Hovel
node.description: This rounded chamber, low-ceilinged and dank, has been converted into a crude home for several families of destitute squatters. All around you are the faces of the poor and hungry, who have found no shelter on Shard's golden streets. The walls are oddly disjointed in places, the sheets of solid rock irregularly placed.

node.name: Undershard, Gallery Fall
node.description: The gallery ends here, at a catastrophic cave-in where a wall of giant boulders and hard-packed earth has closed off the southern vaults forever. A few humanoids dart in and out of a tiny archway to the east, but beyond that, this end of the warrens is unusually quiet.

node.name: Undershard, The Gallery
node.description: Shadowy denizens of the Undershard dart from archway to archway, making their way up and down this long gallery hall. The corridor has become a boulevard of sorts, the main artery of this city-beneath-a-city, and you see merchants and thieves alike travelling the twilit road.

node.name: Undershard, The Gallery
node.description: This broad gallery is a boulevard of sorts, stretching from the northern to the southern ends of Undershard. The stone walls have crumbled and fallen in spots, revealing packed earth and glimpses of natural caverns just beyond, while archways open up onto vaults once used for storing supplies.

node.name: Undershard, The Gallery
node.description: Grooves are worn into the flagstone floor of this vast gallery hall, where wagons were used to haul siege supplies from one end of the Undershard to the other. The gallery runs north and south, beyond the limits of vision.

node.name: Undershard, The Gallery
node.description: The main gallery of the Undershard splits off here, with another broad corridor running east down a slight incline. Most of the wagon tracks seem to roll in that direction, towards what might have once been the main storage vaults. This great hall continues to the north and south.

node.name: Undershard, Low Gallery
node.description: The ceiling of this broad gallery dips low as it intersects with a great boulevard to the west, rotting timbers propping up the dangerously weakened stone walls on either side. The gallery runs eastward, the ground underfoot furrowed with old wagon tracks.

node.name: Undershard, Low Gallery
node.description: Ensconced torches light the way down this long gallery as it runs from east to west, the tunnel serving as a makeshift street for citizens of the Undershard. Many of the small vaults leading off to the north and south have been converted to black market shops or squatters' homes, a crude parody of the city streets just overhead.

node.name: Undershard, Derleth's Teahouse
node.description: Brick walls painted a glistening black, this sedate teahouse seems oddly at home in the warrens of the Undershard. The patrons, a mixed lot, share a common bond of silence: there seems to be an unwritten law against speaking over a whisper in the sparse, dimly-lit chamber.

node.name: Undershard, Teahouse Corridor
node.description: This small corridor has almost completely caved in, forcing you to squeeze around fallen timbers and debris. None of the patrons seem to venture down this corridor, to the darkened room on the eastern end.

node.name: Undershard, Teahouse Storage
node.description: This cramped room is piled high with wooden boxes and crates, storage supplies for the teahouse. Judging from the official Shard government seals on most of the boxes, it doesn't seem as though the teahouse is supplied by a very reputable source. A small corridor leads west, back to the main room.

node.name: Undershard, Caved-In Junction
node.description: Numerous wagon tracks turn to the north, rolling up a vast corridor that intersects with this one. However, a cave-in has destroyed the junction, the northern way blocked off by a wall of solid rock. Whatever was once there is forever lost, and the locals pay the rubble no attention.

node.name: Undershard, Low Gallery
node.description: The low gallery ends here at a sheer stone wall, once ceiling. Their import has been lost, buried beneath countless defacements and lines of obscene graffitti. The gallery runs westward, past archways leading to smaller side vaults.

node.name: Undershard, Temple Foyer
node.description: This short corridor has been converted into the foyer of a temple, the air scented with incense and the walls painted with images of Hodierna. Not a speck of graffitti mars the spotless adornments. Southward, this corridor opens onto a large vaulted chamber.

node.name: Undershard, Temple of Hodierna
node.description: This abandoned storage chamber has been refurnished as a temple, the rough stone walls painstakingly painted with beautiful, elaborate murals. An altar of rosewood stands at the center of the room, lit with beeswax candles and surrounded by small piles of crude offerings from passers-by.

node.name: Undershard, Priest's Bedroom
node.description: This humble chamber, furnished only with a threadbare cot, is the bedroom of this temple's resident cleric. A single candle of pure white wax lights the room, casting a warm glow over the dusty brick walls and keeping back the shadows.

node.name: Undershard, The Wayfarer
node.description: The Wayfarer looks like a bawdy-house in a Dwarven mine, sashes of garish red velvet put up to mask crumbling brick walls. The local clientele is from Undershard's rougher side -- scavengers, mercenaries and thieves -- and they ignore the squalor of their surroundings with help from the local brew. A narrow hallway runs off to the north, and a wide table commands a good view of the room.

node.name: Undershard, Wayfarer Hallway
node.description: The Wayfarer offers a small number of private rooms for entertaining, a black lacquered door and a yellow door flanking either side of this narrow hallway. To the south, the hallway opens up onto the back of the tavern, and ends a short distance to the north.

node.name: Undershard, Wayfarer Hallway
node.description: The short hallway comes to a dead end here, flanked on the east and the west by a green door and a red door. The paint is peeling from the walls in chunks, and the rancid stench of unwashed flesh fills the air.

node.name: Undershard, The Green Room
node.description: Barely bigger than a closet, this destitute nook has been made up as a makeshift bedroom with a filthy, flea-infested mattress. The walls are festooned with putrid green paint, splotched with mildew and decay. A green door leads out to the hallway.

node.name: Undershard, The Red Room
node.description: Barely bigger than a closet, this destitute nook has been made up as a makeshift bedroom with a filthy, flea-infested mattress. The walls are festooned with putrid red paint, splotched with mildew and decay. A red door leads out to the hallway.

node.name: Undershard, The Yellow Room
node.description: Barely bigger than a closet, this destitute nook has been made up as a makeshift bedroom with a filthy, flea-infested mattress. The walls are festooned with putrid yellow paint, splotched with mildew and decay. A yellow door leads out to the hallway.

node.name: Undershard, The Black Room
node.description: Barely bigger than a closet, this destitute nook has been made up as a makeshift bedroom with a filthy, flea-infested mattress. The walls are festooned with putrid black paint, splotched with mildew and decay. A black door leads out to the hallway.

node.name: Undershard, The Gallery
node.description: Arched timbers support the vaulted ceiling some fifteen feet above, where moisture leaks from the crumbling roof and drips into muddy puddles on the dank stone floor. This great gallery continues to the south, and to the north it opens onto a large room, not far up the passage from here.

node.name: Undershard, South of Well
node.description: A great well dominates the center of this vast natural cavern, the rough stone walls reinforced with brick and wooden beams. A passage leads south, to a warren of smaller vaults, and the rubble-strewn ground winds around the well on either side. Further to the north, across the chamber, sounds of shouting can be heard.

node.name: Undershard, East of Well
node.description: A plank runs from east to west across the yawning maw of a wide, open well. Occasionally, a pair of locals will meet on the plank itself and engage in a ritual combat of sorts, leaping about and performing feats of acrobatics until one falls over the edge and into the pit below. Most of the time, the loser manages to crawl back out again. The cavern wall curves around here, running southwest to northwest.

node.name: Undershard, North of Well
node.description: A low ring of crumbling stones encircles the lip of a great well just to the south, and a tunnel leads north to connect this open vault with another one up the passage. Sounds of enthusiastic shouting in many languages drift down the corridor, as if some sort of festival is taking place.

node.name: Undershard, West of Well
node.description: Pitons hold a rotting rope ladder in place, its rungs dangling down into the gaping maw of a dry well. Beside it, a narrow wooden plank has been laid across the well to touch the eastern rim. The cavern curves around here, from southeast to northeast, and a side corridor runs off to the northwest.

node.name: Undershard, On the Plank
node.description: Only a thin plank of green, worm-eaten wood lies between you and the abyss of the great well, its stone shaft plunging into darkness far below. A faint rustling sound echoes up from the pit, like leathery wings preparing to take flight, but nothing moves in the shadows. The plank runs from west to east, touching on either rim of the well.

node.name: Undershard, Sewage Grotto
node.description: An archway to the east opens onto a rounded plateau overlooking a steady stream of raw sewage, pouring from a drainage tunnel to the south. The air is thick with the rancid, oppressive stench of humanoid waste as it slides northward into a second tunnel, this one blocked off with a rusted iron grate. A sign has been hung over the canal, coated with sloppy red paint on a tattered board.

node.name: Undershard, Sewage Tunnel
node.description: A lazy current pushes a river of waste northward. This cramped tunnel angles sharply downward and makes it near-impossible to wade against the filth. Further north, the tunnel opens up into a large area, some sort of underground grotto.

node.name: Undershard, Sewage Tunnel
node.description: The brick ceiling arches downward as the river of sewage rises, and only a small pocket of rancid air allows survival. A slow current moves the sludge northward, odd strands of phosphorus goo casting the narrow tunnel in a sickly green glow.

node.name: Undershard, Sewage Tunnel
node.description: Raw sewage clogs this claustrophobic tunnel, the air choked with nauseating fumes. Tiny creatures wriggle through the muck, their wormlike bodies writhing just beneath the surface. The tunnel slopes downward to the north, into utter darkness.

node.name: Undershard, Access Corridor
node.description: This broad corridor, its stone walls cracked and stained dark with moisture, runs between two large vaulted chambers. The relatively dark and quiet vault to the south is overcome by sounds of parading and shouting to the north, where some sort of bazaar or festival is being held.

node.name: Undershard, The Grey Market
node.description: Citizens of the Undershard mingle all around, merchants and travelers haggling loudly over cheap wares or vanishing into the seclusion of blanket-draped stalls to negotiate for more private services. The Market itself is a maze, the crowds making their own paths from vendor to vendor.

node.name: Undershard, The Grey Market
node.description: Constantly buffeted by swarms of people, it is hard to get one's bearings or even keep safe footing in this labyrinth of makeshift stalls and grey-blanketed booths. Openings seem to appear and vanish in the blink of an eye, as the crowds flow like the tides.

node.name: Undershard, The Grey Market
node.description: Every sort of intelligent being and every walk of life can be seen in the aisles of the Grey Market, from urchins and cutpurses, to adventurers and lesser nobles, the crowds churning in an elaborate dance that only the locals seem to understand. The best an outsider can do is try to move with them, and cut your own path without starting a brawl.

node.name: Shard, Grey Market
node.description: The chatter of merchants assaults your ears in a plethora of languages and accents, as the local vendors swarm about passers-by like flies on a horse. This line of tents and shanties runs straight up to a gap in the cavern walls, reinforced with sagging wooden beams. The locals steer a wide path around a gang of young Elothean toughs lounging casually near the entrance.

node.name: Shard, Grey Market
node.description: The shanty is little more than an open roofed partition, constructed of unmatched bits of wood, paper, and metal, with one side butting up against the cavern wall. Soot stains the walls in one shadowed corner near the back where a ring of stones holds a small fire. Roughly scrawled graffiti in several languages covers every clean spot on the walls and one symbol in particular, a bloody dagger, seems to predominate. It probably belongs to the local gang of thugs whose home this seems to be.

node.name: Undershard, The Grey Market
node.description: The open bazaar of the Undershard is a panorama of odd sights and smells, grey-blanketed stalls and rickety carts selling everything under the sun. The merchants speak in a rapid-fire patois, their catcalls ringing out over the noise of people shouting in seven languages or more.

node.name: Undershard, The Grey Market
node.description: This corner of the market runs up along one of the cavern's walls, the black stone inscribed with old Imperial records but the glyphs long since obscured by crude graffitti and chiseled obscenities. A large stall stands nearby, its billowing sheets woven of purple thread instead of grey like all the others, and the locals give it a wide berth.

node.name: Undershard, The Great Stair
node.description: A winding stair of polished stone has been cut from the face of the rock, spiraling up some thirty feet to great doors of ornate ironwood and flanked by two broad ramps. An Elothean inscription chiseled into the stone at the foot of the stair denotes this as 'The Royal Way'. The stair itself, once an informal gathering-place for the locals, is now blocked off with lengths of rusty chain.

node.name: Undershard, Pursemaster's Office
node.description: Vibrant purple blankets are stretched over a wooden tent-frame, slits cut in the fabric to provide several views of the surrounding marketplace. This is the office of the bazaar's master and warden, Ani'haan, and judging from the bloodstained axe hanging on a stand behind his desk, the place where rough justice is often dispensed.

node.name: Undershard, Grey Market Outskirts
node.description: The few merchants in this area feature items of a different nature and the tempo is much more subdued. Workmen move large crates, their contents carefully concealed behind closely spaced wooden slats, over the edge of a dark causeway. Loosely tied bales surround a rag merchant who sits propped against the wall, his hat covering his face as his assumed pose cries easy mark.

node.name: Undershard, Causeway
node.description: Rough brownstone walls are silent sentinels as the causeway passes over a dark ditch used for flushing refuse out of the area. The loudest shouts from the Grey Market are a tinny echo as they pierce the solitary gloom and bounce off the cobbled floor.

node.name: Undershard, Tunnel Passage
node.description: Relegated into a corner by passing feet, a smear of matted fur is squabbled over by a swarm of minute insects hovering like a cloud of dust motes. Nearby, the scratching sound of claw on cobble hints at a speedier companion than the corpse.

node.name: Undershard, Tunnel Passage
node.description: Like a thief slipping unseen past guards, a small chink overhead admits a narrow shaft of light that slithers to the floor, creating a small puddle on the filthy cobbles. The feeble efforts of what should serve as a ray of brightness fail miserably and serve only to further darken the surroundings.

node.name: Undershard, Tile Tunnel
node.description: Seepage from the ceiling runs down the walls in dark rivulets, leaving behind ridged lime deposits that glisten in the half-light. Green moss draperies spread fuzzy tendrils that further conceal the mosaic tile walls hidden under the grime.

node.name: Undershard, Tile Tunnel
node.description: Changes in the moisture level cause the air here to range between the damp musty scent of the lower tunnels and a dry dust that leaves an itch in the back of the throat. Glinting in the gloom, tile squares reveal a variety of mosaic eyes in shades from corn yellow to mud brown, erratically spaced high along the sides of the tunnel. These mosaic eyes seem able to follow movement and occasionally appear to blink in the twilight.

node.name: Undershard, Tile Tunnel
node.description: Cold white tile, almost antiseptic in its starkness, is broken by mosaics, one set high above its diametrically opposing colleague, as the eye motif develops. The dark center of one wide-open eye stares down and across the expanse at its half-lidded mate, whose mirrored pupil appears to focus on something in the next room.

node.name: Undershard, Cavern of Columns
node.description: Thick columns diagonally shadowed by each other make the perception of depth elusive, and the immediate view of this room shrinks to hide far more than it reveals. Three columns -- purple, white and grey -- almost obscure the rest of the cavern.

node.name: Undershard, Cavern of Columns
node.description: Thick columns diagonally shadowed by each other make the perception of depth elusive, and the immediate view of this room shrinks to hide far more than it reveals. Three columns -- black, white and purple -- almost obscure the rest of the cavern.

node.name: Undershard, Cavern of Columns
node.description: Thick columns diagonally shadowed by each other make the perception of depth elusive, and the immediate view of this room shrinks to hide far more than it reveals. Four columns -- black, teal, bronze, and white -- almost obscure the rest of the cavern.

node.name: Undershard, Cavern of Columns
node.description: Thick columns diagonally shadowed by each other make the perception of depth elusive, and the immediate view of this room shrinks to hide far more than it reveals. Two columns -- teal and black -- almost obscure the rest of the cavern.

node.name: Undershard, Cavern of Columns
node.description: Thick columns diagonally shadowed by each other make the perception of depth elusive, and the immediate view of this room shrinks to hide far more than it reveals. Four columns -- white, bronze, red, and grey -- almost obscure the rest of the cavern.

node.name: Undershard, Cavern of Columns
node.description: Thick columns diagonally shadowed by each other make the perception of depth elusive, and the immediate view of this room shrinks to hide far more than it reveals. Four columns -- bronze, pink, yellow, and red -- almost obscure the rest of the cavern.

node.name: Undershard, Cavern of Columns
node.description: Thick columns diagonally shadowed by each other make the perception of depth elusive, and the immediate view of this room shrinks to hide far more than it reveals. Three columns -- pink, brown, and yellow -- almost obscure the rest of the cavern.

node.name: Undershard, Cavern of Columns
node.description: Thick columns diagonally shadowed by each other make the perception of depth elusive, and the immediate view of this room shrinks to hide far more than it reveals. Three columns -- teal, pink, and bronze -- almost obscure the rest of the cavern.

node.name: Undershard, Cavern of Columns
node.description: Thick columns diagonally shadowed by each other make the perception of depth elusive, and the immediate view of this room shrinks to hide far more than it reveals. Four columns -- yellow, brown, orange, and green -- almost obscure the rest of the cavern.

node.name: Undershard, Cavern of Columns
node.description: Thick columns diagonally shadowed by each other make the perception of depth elusive, and the immediate view of this room shrinks to hide far more than it reveals. Four columns -- red, yellow, green, and blue -- almost obscure the rest of the cavern.

node.name: Undershard, Cavern of Columns
node.description: Thick columns diagonally shadowed by each other make the perception of depth elusive, and the immediate view of this room shrinks to hide far more than it reveals. Three columns -- grey, red, and blue -- almost obscure the rest of the cavern.

node.name: Undershard, Cavern of Columns
node.description: Thick columns diagonally shadowed by each other make the perception of depth elusive, and the immediate view of this room shrinks to hide far more than it reveals. Two columns -- brown and orange -- almost obscure the rest of the cavern.

node.name: Undershard, Cavern of Columns
node.description: Thick columns diagonally shadowed by each other make the perception of depth elusive, and the immediate view of this room shrinks to hide far more than it reveals. Three columns -- green, orange, and silver -- almost obscure the rest of the cavern.

node.name: Undershard, Cavern of Columns
node.description: Thick columns diagonally shadowed by each other make the perception of depth elusive, and the immediate view of this room shrinks to hide far more than it reveals. Three columns -- blue, green, and silver -- almost obscure the rest of the cavern.

node.name: Undershard, Collapsed Tunnel
node.description: Opening onto a large vault to the southeast, this brick tunnel dies out in an abrupt pile of rubble and debris. The same collapse that blocked the northwestern vaults, however, also opened a natural passageway to the north. The northern tunnel slopes downward, and looks utterly deserted from here.

node.name: Undershard, Edge of the Warrens
node.description: A thin ray of pale light streams from a corridor to the south, sloping upward to a tall jumble of rocks. All around, the shattered remains of brick walls mingle with natural rock to create a maze of passages and warrens, the aftermath of a great tremor that destroyed this quarter of Undershard.

node.name: Undershard, Stone Ramp
node.description: The endless warrens open onto a great cavern here, the core of the labyrinth. A vast amphitheatre-like pit lies just to the south, reachable by a long stone ramp that slides down to the arena floor. Torches flanking the ramp crackle and spit, acrid clouds of black smoke obscuring your vision.

node.name: Undershard, The Warrens
node.description: Insane, hysterical laughter echoes faintly in the distance, ringing off the moldy bricks that barely support the low earthen roof. Gouges in the walls open onto several passages, all of them shrouded in darkness.

node.name: Undershard, The Warrens
node.description: This tunnel bends sharply around, opening up into several more passageways. The mazelike warrens never end, looping and twisted like a barrel of snakes.

node.name: Undershard, The Warrens
node.description: The brick walls of an old storage chamber still stand here, pushing back the weight of a cave-in on three sides. Jagged holes in the stone open onto natural tunnels all around.

node.name: Undershard, The Warrens
node.description: This tunnel junction is marked by a splash of sticky brown wetness across one wall -- it is blood, fairly fresh by the looks of it, and whoever shed it was apparently trying to escape this hellish maze. A number of corridors intersect here.

node.name: Undershard, The Warrens
node.description: The shadows that fill this corridor shift and move as if they were alive. Twisting passageways, barely visible as maws of darkness against the crumbling stone walls, lead out of this ruined chamber, looping sinuously back upon themselves.

node.name: Undershard, The Warrens
node.description: A small crack in the ceiling has allowed water to leak through and form a stagnant puddle on the packed-earth floor. The plink of drops of water hitting the pool sends echoes racing through the warrens to confuse the lost and drive the mad even more insane.

node.name: Undershard, The Warrens
node.description: Half of the tunnel to the northwest has been cut off by a recent, massive cave-in. The crumbling stonework walls seem frail compared to this evidence of stone's power.

node.name: Undershard, Canal Junction
node.description: A long, thin stone tunnel winds from the northeast to the south here, dominated by a deep drainage canal filled with icy water. The canal has overflowed the narrow stone walkways on either side by about half an inch, the footing slippery and treacherous. An open archway branches off to the southeast, where it connects to a featureless and near pitch-black corridor.

node.name: Undershard, Drainage Culvert
node.description: A narrow walkway surrounds the lip of a great pit, where water from the northwestern canal pours endlessly through a rusted metal grate and down into darkness. The circular chamber offers no exit but back up the tunnel, and the vast corroded gratework looks like it might cave in at any moment.

node.name: Undershard, Canal Tunnel
node.description: Curving northwest to southwest, this dark tunnel is silent save for the sloshing of water in a narrow drainage canal. Stone walkways flank the canal, providing passage for maintenance workers.

node.name: Undershard, Canal Inlet
node.description: A dark brick tunnel slopes down beneath the city here, narrow stone walkway running alongside a deep canal. The tunnel mouth leads out, back to the city streets, while the stone tube quietly winds to the southeast.

node.name: Undershard, The Warrens
node.description: A coppery, carrion stench fills the tunnel, but its source is nowhere to be seen. Natural tunnels intersect and loop through this tiny cave, with no rhyme or reason.

node.name: Undershard, The Warrens
node.description: Tunnels zig-zag every which way around you, without concern for logic or order. Some double back to this very spot, while others run into one another or end in cave-ins and brick walls.

node.name: Undershard, The Warrens
node.description: This cramped nook is a junction point for several natural tunnels, twisting and winding in all directions. Heavy bootsteps mar the soft dirt, the remnants of travellers who came before.

node.name: Undershard, The Warrens
node.description: Portions of the haphazardly constructed walls in this section of the warrens have fallen down, cluttering the ground and revealing glimpses of great natural caverns beyond. A pile of bones lies upon the rubble, vaguely resembling a humanoid shape.

node.name: Undershard, The Warrens
node.description: The mazelike warrens of Undershard continue to twist and turn, baffling the greatest of trackers. Ratholes line the walls, filling the dark room with the fetid stench of diseased flesh and rotting bodies.

node.name: Undershard, The Warrens
node.description: Deep gouges have been cut into the rock, carving a strange geometric symbol that might have served as a marker for earlier travelers. Its meaning, however, has been lost to time, and provides no clue on which way to turn next.

node.name: Undershard, The Warrens
node.description: A small line of moss grows upon the northern wall, next to one of the many twisting stone passageways that lead through the warrens. Lush and healthy at the top, nearly dead at the bottom, the moss follows the path of a small trickle of water leaking through a crack in the ceiling.

node.name: Undershard, The Warrens
node.description: The ceiling of this chamber is lined with stress fractures and is braced by a rotting wooden beam. A sturdy wooden frame has been erected around each of the myriad twisting paths leading out, to prevent the roof from collapsing.

node.name: Undershard, The Warrens
node.description: Strange echoes fill the room, echoing off the crumbling walls and down the many switchback tunnels that lead through the warrens. Many scratches cover the walls, first in orderly rows then haphazardly, as if in desperation.

node.name: Undershard, The Warrens
node.description: Wisps of smoke hover in this cramped tunnel, the apparent remains of a campfire, but only a few shards of burnt kindling litter the earthen floor. Tunnels branch out in several directions, twisting out of sight.

node.name: Undershard, The Warrens
node.description: Like filaments of an intricate spiderweb, crumbling stone passages lead from the room. Darkness fills each passageway a few feet from the room, making it impossible to tell whether they are dead ends or more of the infuriating looping tunnels that have driven so many mad.

node.name: Undershard, The Warrens
node.description: The skittering of rat claws upon stone fills this nexus of the twisting stone passageways that wind through the warrens of Undershard. Darkness so thick it seems no light can penetrate it fills this room, making it nearly impossible to peer down the tunnels to see which lead to freedom, and which to continuing madness.

node.name: Undershard, The Warrens
node.description: One of the walls to the east has collapsed, leading into a huge natural cavern. Whatever tremor collapsed the one wall also closed off several of the passageways leading from this room.

node.name: Undershard, The Warrens
node.description: This huge cavern is filled with hundreds of stalactites and stalagmites, each as unique as a snowflake. A breeze winds among them, creating a haunting whistling noise that echoes past the remains of a stonework wall to the west, leading into the tunnels of the warren. One large stalagmite, its sides filled with crevices, leads up to a large opening in the ceiling of the cavern.

node.name: Undershard, The Warrens
