node.description: Phosphorescent moss grows on the floor, filling the room with a queasy green light that does nothing to illuminate the pathways leading out. A few insects have made their homes beneath the moss, their shells covered in phosphorescent spores.

node.name: Undershard, The Warrens
node.description: The shadows of the room seem to solidify and move as dark-furred rats crawl in and out of the holes upon the wall. A slight breeze wafts out of one of the myriad tunnels, filling the room with the stench of rotting eggs.

node.name: Undershard, The Warrens
node.description: A high-pitched giggle fills the room and echoes through the warrens. Every few seconds, the wraith-like image of a small Elothean girl flickers into existence, her eyes filled with madness and her lips curled back against her teeth in a perpetual howl of loneliness.

node.name: Undershard, The Warrens
node.description: A yawning chasm splits this great stone cavern in two, just barely narrow enough to leap over. Noxious fumes billow out of the chasm, filling the room with a miasma of death. A slight updraft prevents the fumes from leaking into the rest of the warrens.

node.name: Undershard, The Warrens
node.description: The chunks of rock that fill this room bear the reddish patterns common to rock near a vein of iron ore. It is doubtful the vein is still intact, considering the massive destruction wrought by the cave-in, yet many a prospective miner has begun searching for this instant source of wealth.

node.name: Undershard, The Warrens
node.description: Filled with jagged rocks and debris, the only way through the large room is a narrow pathway cleared by some unknown traveller long ago. From the drops of dried blood spattered upon the rocks and floor, whoever cleared the path did so while trying to run from some unnamed terror.

node.name: Undershard, The Warrens
node.description: The stench of rotten eggs fills the room, coming from a bubbling pool in the northeastern corner. Wafting upon a gentle breeze, the smell is drawn down the myriad tunnels that fill the warrens.

node.name: Undershard, The Warrens
node.description: A stone bedframe, lying in pieces upon the floor, is all that remains of what was once a child's bedchamber. When the cave-in that shattered this portion of Undershard struck, most had enough warning to get out. Although, judging by the gnawed remains of a finger-bone sticking out from under the rubble, not all did.

node.name: Undershard, The Warrens
node.description: The soft glow of light fills this room, coming from a small vein of rose quartz that peeks its way out of the stone ceiling. Stretching all the way to the surface, somehow light refracts down the length of the vein to fill the room with the same glow seen at sunset on a clear day.

node.name: Undershard, Arena of Trothfang
node.description: The arena floor is a theater of horrors, with the stone washed brown in a river of dried and caked blood. The stench of charred flesh rises from a roasting pit in the center of the floor, before a crude shrine to Trothfang built with scraps of brick and severed bone. A metal spike juts up from the center of the pit, the blackened remains of a human skeleton impaled halfway down its length. Empty wine flasks and gnawed bones litter the floor, the remains of some insane cult's revels.

node.name: Undershard, Circle of the New Moon Rising
node.description: The ruined street of a once-beautiful city curves away to the east and west. Looming imposingly over the shattered windows and walls of houses, the slate gray walls of the Arena of Trothfang are split by a large crack to the north.

node.name: Undershard, Circle of the New Moon Rising
node.description: A cold silence fills the air, along with the miasma of bodies long dead and rotting. Trinkets and scraps of cloth litter the ground, along with the gnawed bones that are the only remains of the underground city's inhabitants. Many of the trinkets are those commonly found at festivals throughout Ilithi, as though the citizens were in the midst of some celebration when the caverns collapsed about them.

node.name: Undershard, Circle of the New Moon Rising
node.description: A small mountain of stone debris blocks all passage to the south. Once part of the cavern's roof, the avalanche of stone fell unexpectedly upon the innocent people living below, shattering their homes and their lives. As though in defiant denial of the ancient destruction, thick green moss coats the stones in testimony to life's triumph over destruction.

node.name: Undershard, Path of Kertigen's Gift
node.description: A great chasm lies to the west, blocking all travel in that direction. In the dim light of the caverns, a faint gleam of light can be seen reflecting from the inside of a house split in twain by the chasm. A small skeleton, that of a child or a Halfling, holds onto a mirror even in death.

node.name: Undershard, Circle of the New Moon Rising
node.description: The houses and storefronts lining this stretch of the city street are curiously untouched by the destruction seen elsewhere, almost as if some fickle god had protected them, while leaving their neighbors to die.

node.name: Undershard, Circle of the New Moon Rising
node.description: The bones of a small child hang from an upstairs window like a puppet with its strings cut. Too high for the scavengers to reach, the skeleton remains in perfect condition, save for the chunk of stone imbedded in its skull.

node.name: Undershard, Path of Kertigen's Gift
node.description: A charnel house reek emanates from the crumpled remains of a tavern on the northern side of the street. Layer upon layer of bodies lie pinned beneath rubble covering the porch, an indication of the mass panic to exit the pub before the end came. Hanging from a rotting cord, a decrepit sign sways from the remains of the tavern porch.

node.name: Undershard, Path of Kertigen's Gift
node.description: Towards the east, a great chasm slices through the street with knife-edge precision. One house, split in twain by the chasm, perches precariously upon the edge. Half-rotted furniture and gnawed bones can be seen in the abandoned rooms. A tall spire of stone rises to the south, looming imposingly over the shattered cavern.

node.name: Undershard, The Spire
node.description: Like a giant spear of stone, the Spire rises in overwhelming majesty from the cavern floor. Faded rags hang from a large sign nailed to the base of a small stand beside the Spire.

node.name: Undershard, Cavern of Voices
node.description: The huge cavern is filled with the echoes of long-dead voices. Shouts of laughter and joy vie with screams of pain and terror in the overwhelming cacophony of sound.

node.name: Undershard, Minstrel's Nook
node.description: The small side cavern is filled with the sounds of a small stream of water trickling down one wall. A ledge towards the back is piled high with moldy cushions, the place where Bards once entertained the people of Undershard. On one wall, a small painting provides a clue why this cavern was untouched by the catastrophe.

node.name: Undershard, Path of the Shadow's Brother
node.description: The houses lining the street, decrepit even before the cave-in, are now so fragile that the slightest breeze would turn them to dust. The miasma of long-rotted bodies is, if anything, more pronounced in the area once known as the slum of Undershard.

node.name: Undershard, Path of the Shadow's Brother
node.description: Several houses have collapsed, their rotting wooden frames destroyed from within by various pests. Two houses lean together, forming a narrow alley to the southwest.

node.name: Undershard, Blind Alley
node.description: The walls of the alley press close together. The two collapsed buildings which form this passage rumble and groan as though about to collapse at any second. A faint skittering sound in the shadows fills the room with a sense of danger.

node.name: Undershard, Circle of the New Moon Rising
node.description: A great pile of stone to the north blocks all travel in that direction. The once-lavish city street curves around to the southwest, lined by broken-down houses and a few signs that the houses are once again occupied.

node.name: Undershard, Circle of the New Moon Rising
node.description: A wall to the southwest has completely collapsed, shattering many decrepit houses with it. The destruction has revealed several small caverns not seen in centuries, if ever. The few remaining houses lining the street are a mix of wood and stone that look ready to fall apart at any second.

node.name: Undershard, Caverns
node.description: Phosphorescent moss grows on the floor, filling the cavern with a queasy green light that does little to illuminate the pathways leading south. A few insects have made their homes beneath the moss, their shells covered in phosphorescent spores.

node.name: Undershard, Caverns
node.description: A giant stalactite hangs precariously from the cracked ceiling above. The soft whistling of wind through the cavern fills the air with a sense of suppressed danger.

node.name: Undershard, Circle of the New Moon Rising
node.description: The cavern's collapse shattered the wall to the south, opening pathways to several new caverns. Curving to the north, the shattered remains of the street continue their silent journey.

node.name: Undershard, Circle of the New Moon Rising
node.description: Chips of wood and glass, and large boulders are all that remain of the houses lining this portion of the street. Under one large boulder, a shattered skeleton still tries vainly to protect another from the sky's falling.

node.name: Undershard, Circle of the New Moon Rising
node.description: The gates of a great manor lie warped and twisted shut between the crumbled remains of walls once patrolled by vigilant guards. In the manor's yard, the bones of a small dog can be seen, a steel chain still around its neck leading to a spike in the ground.

node.name: Undershard, Path of the Shadow's Brother
node.description: In an uneasy juxtaposition, the remains of the slums lean against the crumbled wall of a once-prosperous Merchant's house. Once filled with the noise and laughter of parties and family, the mansion is now pierced by a great column of stone.

node.name: Shard, Channel Bank
node.description: A narrow opening in the bedrock leads into darkness here, the faint scent of sewage rising from it. Legend has it that during the Dragon Wars and the occupation of Shard, the priests dug underneath the city, creating warrens and passages deep below. The bubble and splash of the water channel that rushes by to the south tries hard, but cannot drown out the loud creaks and clangs that reverberate out of the opening.

node.name: Shard, Channel Bank
node.description: The angry sound of the madly rushing inner-city channels fills the air as the chilly waters sweep east to west on their way out of Shard. A steep bank nearly thirty feet high pushes its way up to the north, the shadows from the Bridge of Sparrows changing the soil and bedrock that forms the wall of earth from russet brown to umbra.

node.name: Shard, Channel Bank
node.description: Rich brown soil dotted with patches of emerald green grass forms this bank. Gradually changing from soft dirt to the hard bedrock of the city's foundations, the slope rolls down to a bank that allows one to skirt the edge of the rushing water channel over which the Bridge of Sparrows, rising to the west approximately fifteen feet away, allows passage.

node.name: Shard, Dark Hallway
node.description: A narrow alleyway stretches from the main plaza of Undershard towards a nondescript wooden door against the far wall. The alley's walls are covered in layer upon layer of graffiti, new written over old, until no sign of the original walls remains. A couple of local thugs stand barely visible in the shadows, their alert eyes scanning passers by with a frightening intensity.

node.name: Undershard, Tunnels
node.description: A small bubble in the rock has been enlarged and shaped to provide just enough room to stand in. Inside the rounded walls, the incessant cries of the grey market merchants are reduced to mere whispers. A fire outside the entrance lights a long cramped corridor cut through the rock to the northeast.

node.name: Sewer
node.description: The overwhelming stench of raw sewage and rotting vegetable matter creates a miasma that causes the air to shimmer and waver. Water rushes by thickly to the south, vanishing into pitch darkness.

node.name: Malik the True Bard, Instruments and Picks
node.note: Malik the True Bard|Bard Shop|Music Shop|Instruments
node.description: Less a shop and more an extension of Malik's living room, several tasteful couches and lounges have been arranged in aesthetically pleasing positions about the room, the better to allow the true musicians who visit this shop to test the owner's handiwork. A fine array of instruments and their complimenting tools lay behind a display and hang from the walls, looking more than just pretty.

node.name: Shard, Kilam's Locks
node.description: Hidden away in the basement beneath Malik's Musical Instruments lies the shop of his brother Kilam, Shard's specialist in locks and picks. The shop's walls and floor are bare unfinished stone, while heavy pine beams support the building above. Subdued street noises filter through a narrow barred window near the ceiling, and occasional muffled footsteps echo through the quiet store as booted feet walk overhead.

node.name: Sierack's Reagents, Showroom
node.description: Bones hang from the ceiling by lengths of twine, clicking against one another as the taller customers make their way through the aisles. Bottles, jars, and beakers filled with strange and undefinable objects have been piled precariously on the shelves beside grimoires, talismans, cambrinth balls, and other magical devices. Amidst the cluttered showroom sits the eccentric Sierack, surveying his shop with a narrowed and territorial expression on his face.

node.name: Shard's Osut'vie
node.description: Indefinable odors waft from various mortars, pots and cauldrons on tables and shelves throughout the shop. Herbs, carefully dried and cured, hang in bunches from a drying rack suspended from the ceiling. Everything the serious alchemist could possibly want or need can be found in here. A section of shelving separates a tall ironbound door from a smaller wood door on the opposite wall.

node.name: Zieq's Office
node.description: A small battered desk crouches in the corner opposite the door. Floor to ceiling shelves, crammed with books and alchemy tools, stand against all four walls. Strange substances bubble and splutter in glass jars.

node.name: Osut'vie Stillroom
node.description: Rows of shelves, crammed with books on alchemy, tools of the trade, and a hodgepodge of herbs and components, line the room. High on one wall, the lone window is covered over with heavy fabric, keeping the room in perpetual twilight to protect sensitive components. The herbalist Idizieq stands behind the counter, happily working on his experiments at a low table in between helping customers.

node.name: Temple of Darkness, Foyer
node.description: Strands of silver shoot through the black marble laid into the floor of the temple, spinning out across the glossy floor like the webs of some elaborate and unseen spider. Shadows fall like curtains from the walls, concealing alcoves and small niches where statues of gods take residence. Further down the hall to the north the darkness deepens as it allows access to the main hall of the temple.

node.name: Temple of Darkness, Hall
node.description: The ceiling of the main hall climbs up in a steep curve of black marble. Light from an unseen source shoots up out of ledges on the long sides of the hall, glancing off the facets of small diamonds that have been embedded in the vaulted roof. The distant echo of someone crying softly carries through the narrow hall, coming from deeper in the darkness that lies to the north.

node.name: Temple of Darkness, Gela Erorien
node.description: On the wall opposite the doorway, a panoramic mural shows a red sun setting behind distant mountains to the west of Shard. Painted clouds on the wall and ceiling shade from cream to rose as the sky around them blends imperceptibly from crimson to the indigo overhead to the velvet black of the eastern wall.

node.name: Temple of Darkness, Gela Wepaten
node.description: At first glance, the room seems an open space beneath a starry sky: the dim light and the dull black of the walls merge into a dimensionless space in the center of which candles glow on a black altar. Their light reflects from hundreds of tiny silvered points on the ceiling.

node.name: Temple of Darkness, Hall
node.description: A ring of white marble sits in the dead center of the main hall. Blindingly white, the ring seems almost to be there to bind the darkness that permeates the whole of this holy place. Corridors to the east and west lead off into separate wings, their exact terminus lost in the darkness that cloaks the expanse of the temple. The flickering of candles illuminate the way to the north and south, teasing the eye with the promise of more light.

node.name: Temple of Darkness, Western Alcove
node.description: A stone carving rises up out of the smooth face of the wall at the end of this alcove like some strange wave breaking the surface of a frozen obsidian waterfall. The only illumination is the light coming from the main hall to the east, which is itself only fitful at best.

node.name: Temple of Darkness, Eastern Alcove
node.description: A dark portal has forced itself upon the wall at the end of this alcove, the edges pulling at the black marble and drawing it close in a swirling embrace of greys and obsidians. To the west, fleeting, sickly illumination attempts to break through the eternal night of the temple.

node.name: Temple of Darkness, Glassus' Shop
node.description: The walls and floor of this sparsely furnished but clean room are of gold-veined white marble. A series of immaculate countertops displays a variety of god-related artwork. The proprietor of the shop, a smiling grey-cloaked monk by the name of Glassus, can often be found at his desk casually plucking the feathers from a dead and bloody pigeon.

node.name: Temple of Darkness, Grand Chamber
node.description: Corridors shoot out in all directions, a spider's maze of passages. Wax splotches the floor in the center of the hall where the candles fixed in a wooden chandelier overhead have dripped down and frozen on the chilly marble. Mixed sounds of chanting and weeping echo through the hall, a cacophony of cruelty multiplied tenfold by whatever dark architect designed the chamber to echo the world's sorrows with such crystal-clear clarity.

node.name: Temple of Darkness, Botolf's Alcove
node.description: The quality of light is dim and fuzzy here, as if some sort of thick miasma obfuscates your vision no matter which way you turn your gaze. A figure in shining armor stands at the back of the alcove, a mighty two-handed weapon clasped point-down against its chest.

node.name: Temple of Darkness, Hall of Agony
node.description: Cries of pain echo through the hall, rising from soft to loud before crashing back down to a whimper. Engravings of various scenes of torture from the past of Ilithi twist their way out of the wall, evoking a macabre sense of fascination to the casual eye. The lighting is brighter here, intentionally harsh to cause a strain on the eyes and a nagging headache on the brain.

node.name: Temple of Darkness, Asketi's Alcove
node.description: A hearth is sunk into the floor in the center of this dim and chilly alcove, ashes from a long-dead fire spreading across the bottom. A draft as chill as the north wind Asketi rides swirls through the air, rustling the various withered flowers and decomposing apples that are offered here in hopes of appeasing the cruel goddess.

node.name: Temple of Darkness, Dergati's Alcove
node.description: No permanent light fixtures have been set up anywhere in honor of the goddess of true darkness. Despite this, there is a definite air of tidiness -- someone has been polishing the floors and walls, and making sure that not a speck of dust mars the alabaster statue of Dergati that rests to the rear of the small shrine.

node.name: Temple of Darkness, Aldauth's Alcove
node.description: Larger than the other alcoves in deference to the god of dark endings, most of the space is wasted since the only permanent fixture is a small black altar in the center of the rectangular room. The air is neither hot nor cold, and there is no discernable fragrance. Stripped down to the bare black marble floor, walls and altar, this is a quiet statement of just what we take with us when Aldauth pays his final visit.

node.name: Temple of Darkness, Hall of Vengeance
node.description: Crossed broken swords ornament the walls, side-by-side with the rent and rusted armor of those who have taken the oath of blood in the name of justice. Torches flicker in sconces, casting shifting, churning light over everything but never quite reaching the ceiling. There is a musty scent here, like that of stagnation.

node.name: Temple of Darkness, Trothfang's Alcove
node.description: This shrine is completely bare of any form of ornament or decoration. Not even a statue graces the alcove, the only permanent fixture being a brass brazier on a tripod in the center. The scent of burning flesh and the faint tang of copper hangs in the air, the subtle taste of the god of pain.

node.name: Temple of Darkness, Drogor's Alcove
node.description: The tang of salt hangs in the air, coming from the saltwater-filled fountain in the center of the alcove. A glowering statue of Drogor as his Gor'Tog self stands in the center of the fountain, up to his mid-calves in water. A small shark swims through the water, preying on the tiny gobbets of flesh that are dropped in by the local priests.

node.name: Temple of Darkness, Be'ort's Alcove
node.description: Unnerving silence fills this small and mostly unextraordinary alcove. The only point of interest here is the statue of Be'ort that huddles in the back.

node.name: Temple of Darkness, Hall of Death
node.description: A lingering chill slips from between the seams of the walls and the glossy black floor, calling up the memory of aching bones in winter time. The faint scent of burning blood and the taste of salt and copper hang in the air, tickling the senses like a finger applied to the back of the throat.

node.name: Temple of Darkness, Harawep's Alcove
node.description: This alcove is almost completely entombed with strands of sticky white cobwebs. A draft ruffles some of the webbing, which all but covers the statue of Harawep huddled in the back of the tiny room. Peering out from behind a veil of spidersilk, the hunched goddess glares and clutches a set of knitting needles. The uncomfortable presence of shadowy movement near the back reveals a nest of black widow spiders who keep the walls and ceiling well-shrouded.

node.name: Temple of Darkness, Kerenhappuch's Alcove
node.description: An ivory statue of Kerenhappuch in full skirt and low-cut blouse is located at the end of this alcove, the lighting at her feet and casting interesting shadows, especially around her chiseled eyes, which dance in the wicked light. Gold leaf has been applied to her hair, and cinnamon incense cones lie burning at her feet, filling the air with a heady, spicy odor.

node.name: Temple of Darkness, Zachriedek's Alcove
node.description: The sour smell of vinegar and the musty odor of molding bread fill the air of this small and stuffy alcove. A glowering, hunched-over relief of Zachriedek pops out of the wall furthest from the hall, his features rough from an unkind artist's chisel. Fine cracks seam his face and body, as if it were about to crumble.

node.name: Temple of Darkness, Hall of Madness
node.description: Faint giggling and the definite scent of overly powerful incense floats in through a set of appallingly gawdy draperies over an alcove to the north. The acoustics of this part of the temple are good -- almost painfully so as they amplify the sound of desperate laughter in a steady flurry that borders on cacophony.

node.name: Temple of Darkness, Ushnish's Alcove
node.description: Carnelian bands of gypsum twist like snakes in the floor here, writhing as they move up to the statue of Ushnish at the back of the room. The granite statue of the god of treacherous rage is uncharacteristically calm in this carving, his serpentine eyes gazing quietly down and his hands folded in front of him as he clasps his famous iron-shod staff. There is a deep sense of solitude here, as if the alcove were located miles below the earth.

node.name: Temple of Darkness, Huldah's Alcove
node.description: The air is filled with a static feel, like a thunderstorm waiting to burst. Veins of dark blue lapis shoot through the floor and walls, flashing like streaks of lightning. The statue of Huldah that stands here is shaped from solid iron and plated in copper that is gradually growing greenish with age.

node.name: Temple of Darkness, Idon's Alcove
node.description: Garish pillows and blankets are spread out along the floor of this small shrine. Curtains in appalling colors and of various incredibly expensive fabrics hang from the walls, draping the statue of Idon who stands smirking toward the back. The strong scent of burning, spicy incense permeates the air.

node.name: Shard, Temple of Light
node.description: Gold-veined white marble columns set upon square gilt bases support an arching roof with a fresco depicting the final battle between the Immortals and the World Dragon. Hushed voices echoing from hidden alcoves soothe all who enter with melodious chants. Candles burning in niches lining the walls between the pillars provide soft illumination. A pair of embossed silver doors leading out onto the street stand wide open.

Light from candles set in wall niches reflects off gold-veined white marble columns to relieve the night's shadows. Hushed voices chanting an eternal lullaby filter from unseen alcoves. A pair of embossed silver doors stands open just wide enough for a soul to slip through to the street.

node.name: Temple of Light, Gela Ortegunen
node.description: The four walls of the room to north, east, west, and south are painted with the vistas seen from the highest tower of the city. The views recede from the foreground of the roofs of Shard at the bottom of the walls and lead the eye upward to a distant horizon in every direction. The ceiling directly above a wooden altar shows a golden sun.

node.name: Temple of Light, Gela Arenen
node.description: The first sight on entering the room is the eastern wall, covered with a vast painting of the lands stretching to the east of Shard. The other walls of the square room continue the panorama of views to the north, west, and south. Above the horizon on the east wall, the rosy fingers of dawn reach toward the ceiling, across which the colors darken to a deep, velvety purple above the dim mountains on the western horizon.

node.name: Temple of Light, Dim Alcove
node.description: A single candle burns steadily on a long wooden table here. The stone bench pushed up against it looks hard and cold, but a beautiful illuminated book lies open on the table's surface, beckoning those who seek the wisdom of the gods to sit and study.

node.name: Temple of Light, Grand Hall
node.description: An alabaster dome, inset with crystal prisms and held aloft by vaulted arches, soars above the polished tile floor. Light filtering through the prisms creates a dancing multi-hued aurora high above the fountain. Centered beneath the dome is a fountain bubbling with water stained by the colorful reflected light. A series of detailed mosaic animal images symbolizing the deities paves the path between the fountain and surrounding arches.

An alabaster dome, inset with crystal prisms and held aloft by vaulted arches, soars above the polished tile floor. Dim light from the stars and city is diffused through the prisms to wash the dome in pale hues. Centered beneath the dome is a fountain bubbling with clear water. A series of detailed mosaic animal images symbolizing the deities paves the path between the fountain and surrounding arches.

node.name: Temple of Light, Terrace
node.description: A curved slate-paved terrace running the length of the temple stretches outwards from the building. The terrace area is enclosed by a marble railing. Wrought iron tables and chairs dot the terrace for those who wish to enjoy the view of the gardens below.

node.name: Temple of Light, Fountain of One
node.description: Elegant and austere, the Fountain of One is a circular pool sculpted from gold-veined marble. Within the pool, partially submerged visages of the Immortals exhale plumes of water which meld to form a single spray rising to touch the aurora above.

node.name: Temple of Light, Garden Archway
node.description: A gravel path lined with green ferns leads from the bottom of the steps to the garden entrance. Creeping vines covered with delicate violet blooms cling to the archway and small urns with potted flowers line the sides of the path.

node.name: Temple of Light, Contemplation Garden
node.description: The gravel path winds from the archway to create a perfect circle. Various medicinal herbs line the sides of the path, creating an aromatic border. Inside the circle a low cut hedge, barely knee-high, forms an intricate maze ending at a sundial set in a tiny inner circle.

node.name: Temple of Light, Alcove of Smaragdaus
node.description: More like a tap-room than a chapel, tarts and juice offered on long banquet tables tempt worshippers. Cheerful tapestries of people dancing, couples courting and families enjoying life together adorn the walls. On the domed ceiling, a painting of a laughing man, mug in hand, watches over all who come to visit. Soft cushions are tossed around the room for people to rest comfortably.

node.name: Temple of Light, Alcove of Lemicus
node.description: A gigantic mosaic of the sun rising over the ocean fills one entire wall of the chapel. An equally large mosaic of a woman bidding her husband farewell before he sails covers the opposite wall. A table pushed against the third wall holds a brazier filled with the ashes of burned prayer scrolls. Two plain wooden benches sit back-to-back in the middle of the room.

node.name: Temple of Light, Alcove of Rutilor
node.description: An effigy of a warrior in full plate lies upon a raised stone dais carved with the images of baying hounds. One wall is inscribed with the Paladin's Code, the other walls are adorned with rich tapestries illustrating legendary enchanted weaponry. Hard stone benches line the walls for repenting pilgrims.

node.name: Temple of Light, Alcove of Eylhaar
node.description: Dark grey walls enclose a somber chamber dominated by an ebony dais in the center of the room. Censers in the four corners fill the air with the aroma of sandalwood. Worshippers repeat hushed prayers of peace for departed friends and relatives as others sit in silence, remembering the dead. Ebony pews with kneeler boards are set before the altar.

node.name: Temple of Light, Alcove of Divyaush
node.description: Modest by a wealthy trader's terms, the chapel has an intricately carved altar surrounded by glass cases in which each craftsman's art is represented. Tools made from precious metals and set with gems decorate the chapel's walls along with a sumptuous tapestry depicting Divyaush appraising an Elven longsword. Over in one corner is a stack of thick prayer mats to soften the hard floor for praying knees.

node.name: Temple of Light, Alcove of Phelim
node.description: Heavy black velvet drapery covers the walls, muffling sound and light. Blue, red and black models of Elanthia's moons hang from the ceiling, glowing gently from some internal illumination. In the black ceiling above, twinkling white crystals form the constellations of the thirteen light aspects of the Immortals. A small onyx-topped altar rests in the center of the room, and padded pews set at a deep angle allow comfortable contemplation.

node.name: Temple of Light, Alcove of Murrula
node.description: A statue of a woman playing a flute stands in this acoustically perfect chapel. Her eyes gaze over the room as if judging the voices of the bards that gather around her. The wall behind the statue is decorated with images of musical instruments, and the wall across from it has a small stage built against it. Cushions are stacked near the stage, ready to be used during impromptu concerts.

node.name: Temple of Light, Alcove of Peri'el
node.description: A marble statue of a S'kra woman, graceful arm bent to her harp as she sits before a recumbent dragon, fills the center of the chamber. Lame and half-blind, she seems oddly peaceful as she sings her eternal song, pausing only to sprinkle sand on the sleeping dragon. A niche in one of the walls holds several conch shells. Marble benches line the smooth marble walls, giving people a place to sit while admiring the statue.

node.name: Temple of Light, Alcove of Berengaria
node.description: Two tinted glass walls and a skylight illuminate the worshippers in a garden-like sanctuary. Vines curl from niches in the other walls. At the center of the room, surrounded by wrought iron benches and raised beds of herbs is a statue of Berengaria in a circle of violets and bellflowers. At the statue's feet are baskets of grain offered by those seeking her blessing.

node.name: Temple of Light, Alcove of Kuniyo
node.description: Tapestries on the chapel walls show lush jungles filled with stalking beasts. From brass planters near the ceiling, vines cascade to the floor, where rough rush mats and potted palms surround a bamboo altar. Several small rattan stools dot the room for those who wish to remain to commune with their god.

node.name: Temple of Light, Alcove of Albreda
node.description: The floor is inlaid with a massive seven-pointed star. At each point, there is a small stone table with a statuette representing one of the seven races. In the middle of the inlaid star there is a large sculpture representing all races, their hands reaching towards the heavens. From the ceiling, a painting of Albreda smiles down at the figures. Padded benches line the walls for those who wish to rest here.

node.name: Temple of Light, Alcove of Alamhif
node.description: Colorful frescos of happy children bolster the cheerful tone of this alcove. Laughing and shrieking joyfully, children of all races are pictured running and playing. Overlooking their antics is an old man with a kind face holding an injured magpie gently in his hands. A low table holding a bowl filled with peppermints and taffy rests against one wall and brightly-colored cushions are provided for sitting upon.

node.name: Temple of Light, Alcove of Firulf
node.description: The air in the room seems to crackle with elemental energy as an unwavering light shines through a wall-sized stained-glass picture of Firulf watching mages in battle. The colored radiance from the glass falls on the altar in the center of the chamber. The other walls are polished bare grey granite. Scarlet velvet floor pillows trimmed with gold braid provide seating for those who choose to meditate here.

node.name: Sister Imadrail's Emporium
node.description: A soft light illuminates this small shop, lending a gentle glow to the matronly Sister Imadrail who quietly walks about tending to the inventory or customers. Despite its marble floor the room is surprisingly silent, all sound muffled before the array of the holy instruments of the gods. The air is rich with the scent of sandalwood incense.

node.name: Fiona's Fine Swords and Shields, Front Room
node.description: The sharp smell of burning pine and a touch of heat on the skin marks the presence of the forge in the back of this mostly stone-crafted building. Swords hanging from the seamlessly fitted granite walls glow in the light, gleaming with the polish and care that has been lavished on them. Fiona Lightwielder, the owner of the shop, watches her inventory and clientele from where she sits before a table of knife pieces, fitting them together methodically.

node.name: Silver Eye, Foyer
node.description: Pale silk curtains frame frosted glass windows that are set into the walls of the spacious foyer. A registration desk stands in the center, wealthy traders and distinguished dilletantes passing by. Elegant glass vases and lifesculpted plants add an elegant air to this place.

node.name: Silver Eye, Hall of Heroes
node.description: Portraits of ancient heroes line the walls. A bust of the Ferdahl Kukalakai rests on a marble pedestal in the center of the room. A wool carpet covers the cold stone floor.

node.name: Silver Eye, Hallway
node.description: A plush golden wool runner trails from one end of the hallway to a large winding oak stair. Gilded sculptures line the walls, ornate carvings of wood poised in elegant embraces. A potted t'gora plant perfumes the air with a thick, heady scent as its snow-white blossoms open wide in the dim lighting of the room.

node.name: Silver Eye, Tavern Room
node.description: A warm fire throws mottled shadows over the dark corners. People sit chatting in quiet voices, toasting with mulled ale and fine spring wines. The scent of roasted meat drifts through the air.

node.name: Silver Eye, Bar
node.description: A tall Elothean stands behind a slender obsidian bar serving drinks and food. Pale silk cloths cover round wooden tables. The thick scent of elven wine permeates the air. Flickering candle lights hover softly, their soft illuminations casting shadows around the room.

node.name: Silver Eye, Corridor
node.description: A golden oak stair winds down the wall, descending to the bottom level of the inn. Ceramic vases filled to the brim with delicate white and silver roses line the walls. An ornate wooden sculpture stands near the center of the room.

node.name: Silver Eye, Corridor
node.description: Soft pastel silk panels line the hallway, draping gently over closed windows made from fine frosted glass. The wooden walls beneath are carved with elaborate etchings of fluid dragons and elegant, regal birds.

node.name: Silver Eye, Residential Corridor
node.description: A gracefully curving golden oak staircase sweeps down to the second floor at the southern end of the hallway. Private apartments line the corridor, occupied by guests who value the convenience and efficient service offered by the inn.

node.name: Silver Eye, Residential Corridor
node.description: A plush ivory wool carpet woven with a pale blue lattice and edged with golden roses runs the length of the corridor. Fluted alabaster pedestals stand beside each doorway, bearing porcelain jars filled with fragrant k'dira leaves and dried lemon blossoms.

node.name: Silver Eye, Residential Corridor
node.description: Away from the bustle of transient guests, the residential quarters of the Silver Eye display the same quiet elegance that marks the rest of the inn. Silken hangings in pale shades of blue and gold cover the walls, providing a backdrop for still life paintings that line the corridor.

node.name: Silver Eye, Room of Silver Stars
node.description: Small silver stars are painted on the night-blue ceilings and walls. Fine crystalline threads beaded with flecks of obsidian and onyx drift and shimmer in a slight breeze. A large bed stands beneath a large round window. Dark indigo silk is draped over the soft pillows, brushing gently against the ebonwood floor.

node.name: Silver Eye, Room of Lilies
node.description: Hundreds of silk lilies are stitched into the ivory lace curtains of the room, the satin patina blanket elegantly draped over the bed, and the plush chenille hanging that lies against the wall. White blossoms with seemingly impossibly soft petals shimmer with moisture as if freshly picked, their scent light and refreshing.

node.name: Silver Eye, Sable and Wine Suite
node.description: A large circular feather bed stands in the center of the room. Elegant silver sconces cusp fine ivory candles in their grasp. Delicate crystal roses rest in bejewelled arrangements, neatly placed in porcelain vases.

node.name: Silver Eye, Winter Suite
node.description: Thick white velvet blankets cover a large pile of pillows in the center of the room. Elegant etchings of translucent ice fairies whirl in a frenzied dance around the stark walls of the room. Delicate crystal snowflakes hang suspended from the ceiling on delicate silver chains.

Thick white velvet blankets cover a large pile of pillows in the center of the room. Elegant etchings of translucent ice fairies whirl in a frenzied dance around the stark walls of the room. Delicate crystal snowflakes hang suspended from the ceiling on delicate silver chains.

node.name: Zerek's General Store
node.description: Freshly varnished wooden walls and impeccably swept floors attest to a measure of careful observance to the custom of tidiness by Zerek and his staff. Shelves on the walls hold various sundries necessary for the survival of travellers and city-dwellers alike, and the open windows supply plenty of light to see by.

node.name: Meiria's Gems and Jewelry, Fatimi the Dealer's Backroom
node.note: Fatimi the Dealer's Backroom|Meiria's Gems and Jewelry|Veilex|gems
node.description: Sparsely furnitured by two chairs in which Fatimi's son Veilex the gemcutter entertains those who come selling gems, there is a sense of opulent antiquity here. Sipping tea and looking a little ghostly in the oil lamp light, Veilex smiles with suave assurance at the local gold-diggers and adventurers who arrive to haggle with him. A door in the west wall leads into the jewelry store proper, now closed for the evening.

Sparsely furnitured by two chairs in which Meiria's partner, the Elven gemcutter Fatimi, entertains those who would sell her gems, there is a sense of opulent antiquity here. The tireless Lady Fatimi waits from her seat as the local gold-diggers and adventurers arrive with their finds to sell. A painted white door in the west wall leads into the jewelry store proper.

node.name: Quentin's Healerium
node.description: Loose boards of white-washed wood and a collection of dingy tapestries that reek of dust and mold compose this small, windowless hovel. Oddly, there is little detectable tell-tale scent of blood, although the walls are splashed liberally with bright red splotches. A single oil lamp hangs overhead, and the only other light source is the open door leading out.

node.name: Lady Atladene's Salon, Entryway
node.description: Thick blue carpet covers the floor of the entryway, a strip of rich purple down the center to accent it. Painted murals cover the walls, alive with vibrant hues that pull at the eyes. The faint sound of talking and laughter echoes down the corridor that leads into the parlor, where the upper class of Shard gather to chat and dine.

node.name: Lady Atladene's Salon, Parlor
node.description: Paintings of famous heroes hang upon the walls of the salon's expansive parlor. Young Elven men and women move silently amongst the patrons, replenishing glasses and taking orders. Crystal and gold lamps filled with azure oil offer illumination, and a wide hearth provides warmth in the bitterest of weather. Music floats in from behind a rosewood screen in the northeast corner, and a private booth off to one side allows for more intimate discussion.

node.name: Lady Atladene's Garden, Roses
node.description: Rose bushes seem to be the Lady's favorite choice, judging by their prominence in the garden. Blooms of all colors -- from the brilliant white, to the blushing pink and violet, to the rare black -- flourish in neatly manicured rows. A soft carpet of grass rolls over the ground, clipped to a seemly inch and a half. A small path meanders off to a flowery glade, and a stone-inlaid walkway leads to the Salon's pool. A beveled glass door allows entry back into the house.

The scents of the roses of the daytime have been replaced by that of the night-blooming jasmine and midnight glories. A faint trace of dew sparkles in the grass like a Fae's strewn diamonds, the delicately crafted jewels dissolving at the merest touch of mortal hands. A small path meanders off to a flowery glade, and a stone-inlaid walkway leads to the Salon's pool. A beveled glass door allows entry back into the house.

node.name: Lady Atladene's Garden, Healer's Glade
node.description: Ringed by succulent bushes dotted with flowers kept blooming by the gentle ministrations of skilled lifesculptors, the personal glade of Lady Atladene is canopied by twining ivy and interwoven leaves of the tall birch and willow trees that grow here. The Lady herself sits at the center of the glade, waiting for the wounded with the patience of Death.

Ringed by succulent bushes dotted with flowers kept blooming by the gentle ministrations of skilled lifesculptors, the personal glade of Lady Atladene is canopied by twining ivy and interwoven leaves of the tall birch and willow trees that grow here. The Lady herself sits at the center of the glade, waiting for the wounded with tireless patience.

node.name: Lady Atladene's Garden, Poolside
node.description: Green grass grows at the edge of the natural pool that lies on the west side of Lady Atladene's home. Ripples disturb the surface as hummingbirds and larks skim the surface, sipping up the cool liquid to quench throats dry from singing. The laughter of swimmers and the splash of water flashes through the air, the reportedly therapeutic spring warm throughout all seasons.

The scents of the roses of the daytime have been replaced by that of the night-blooming jasmine and midnight glories. A faint trace of dew sparkles in the grass like a Fae's strewn diamonds, the delicately crafted jewels dissolving at the merest touch of mortal hands. A small path meanders off to a flowery glade, and a stone-inlaid walkway leads to the Salon's pool. A beveled glass door allows entry back into the house.

Green grass grows at the edge of the natural pool that lies on the west side of Lady Atladene's home. Ripples disturb the surface as nightingales skim the surface, sipping up the cool liquid to quench throats dry from singing. Glowing starflowers bob upon the water's surface, offering up warm golden, pink, and blue light for those whose swimming preference tends toward the nocturnal.

node.name: Lady Atladene's Garden, Pool
node.description: A wellspring of warm water ripples up from the center of the pool, lacing the air with just the faintest hint of sulfur. Soft golden sand covers the bottom, paintings of shells and seahorses decorating the sides. A shelf runs the rim of the pool, for those who wish to sit and relax in the therapeutic waters.

node.name: Lady Atladene's Salon, Private Booth
node.description: Secluded and just slightly gloomy, the booth is lit by a single lamp that sits in the center of the table. The sweet scent of honeysuckle is complimented by the sharper aroma of sandalwood to wreathe the air with the memory of pressed flowers and woods. The padded backs and seats of the benches offer respite for those who have found the journey of life a wearying one.

node.name: Golden Phoenix, Front Desk
node.description: Two brass lamps topped with stained glass shades rest on a carved rosewood check-in desk where a supercilious-looking clerk watches the lobby. The walls are covered with gold damask, tasseled silk cords hold velvet drapes away from leaded windows and wing chairs upholstered with figured satin sit around a low carved table. A plaster molding relief of intertwined flowers and leaves decorates the ceiling and wool runner carpets protect the polished wood floor. A heavy oak door leads out to the street.

Candlelight filtering through stained glass lampshades washes the ceiling's plaster molding with soft hues. The desk clerk stands behind a carved rosewood check-in desk, watching the activity in the lobby with a haughty gaze. The walls are covered with gold damask, tasseled silk cords pull heavy velvet drapes away from the windows, and figured satin wing chairs sit around a low table. Woven wool runner carpets protect the polished wood floor. A heavy oak door leads out to the street.

node.name: Golden Phoenix, Tavern Room
node.description: The sharp scent of spices overlays the yeast of baking bread and the savor of roasting meats. Sunlight sparkles off cut-glass decanters and gleaming china on immaculate linen tablecloths. Pale yellow rosebuds in crystal vases are placed on each table along with a leather-bound menu, and gold flatware place settings are meticulously laid out, ready for the guest's dining pleasure. Booths nestled against the walls allow for privacy, or guests can choose to sit at a table.

The sharp scent of spices overlays the yeast of baking bread and the savor of roasting meats. Candlelight sparkles off cut-glass decanters and gleaming china on immaculate linen tablecloths. Pale yellow rosebuds in crystal vases are placed on each table along with a leather-bound menu, gold flatware place settings are meticulously laid out, ready for the guest's dining pleasure. Booths nestled against the walls allow for privacy, or guests can choose to sit at a table.

node.name: Golden Phoenix, Bar
node.description: A massive rosewood bar runs the length of one wall, its surface polished to a high gloss. Behind the bar are rows of glasses, bottles and decanters stacked on shelves within easy reach of the bartender. Tables dot the room, ample space is left between them to allow for privacy. A young couple dances as a bard sitting on a small platform plucks a spritely tune from his mandolin.

Faint whispers and the sound of clinking glasses circulate through the room. The bartender gazes impassively at each person entering, allowing a slight smile for repeat customers and a nod for new faces. The dim candlelight from the center of each table casts a soft glow, making this a favorite place for couples looking for a romantic spot for a nightcap before retiring for the evening. A bard sits on a small platform coaxing a slow, sultry melody from his lute.

node.name: Golden Phoenix, Corridor
node.description: Delphiniums mixed with green fern fill a glazed blue urn sitting upon a metal stand, and the walls are covered with azure and gold striped paper topped with gilded moulding. Brass rods hold the runner carpet covering the stairs in place and the aroma of lemony beeswax polish lingers about the rosewood bannister.

node.name: Golden Phoenix, Trophy Room
node.description: Brass candle sconces vie for space with dozens of antlers, some still attached to the hunted's head, on the paneled walls. Centered between the two largest trophies is a portrait of an Elothean man, while the opposite wall is decorated with a tapestry depicting a boar hunt. Two overstuffed sofas face each other across a low table set with a decanter and brandy snifters, ready for afterdinner conversation.

node.name: Golden Phoenix, Hallway
node.description: The upper hallway is decorated with the same azure and gold striped paper and gilded moulding as in the lower corridor. A glass frame holding a colorful pressed flower arrangement hangs opposite a marble statue atop a metal stand.

node.name: Golden Phoenix, Hallway
node.description: The azure and gold striped paper and gilded moulding continues throughout the hallway. A mirror held by a gilded metal frame embellished with sculpted roses hangs on the wall at the end of the corridor.

node.name: Golden Phoenix, Phoenix Suite
node.description: A mosaic of a phoenix above the mantle gives an illusion of the creature rising from the flames of the fireplace. Tapestries hang on the dark wood paneled walls, scarlet satin clothes the bed and pillows, and heavy ecru lace curtains adorn the windows. A chess table, its figures carved of red and black marble, sits on a black laquered table.

node.name: Golden Phoenix, Gryphon Suite
node.description: A colorful hand-painted silk screen depicting battling gryphons stands to one side of a dark green lacquered wardrobe. An inlaid writing desk holding a white quill pen and sheets of parchment neatly stacked on the blotter sits near the window. A pale green bolster within a crocheted case rests on the polished cotton comforter covering the bed, and a lace dust ruffle cascades from under the bedclothes to brush the floor.

node.name: Golden Phoenix, Pegasus Suite
node.description: White silk curtains held apart by gold cord hang at the windows and the pure white fur of some polar animal carpets the floor in front of the fireplace. The walls are covered in pale blue silk, a mural depicting a winged horse charging through the clouds is painted on the ceiling. A large brass-posted bed topped by a canopy of sheer white fabric dominates the center of the room.

node.name: Golden Phoenix, Roc Suite
node.description: Deep blues pervade the room, casting shadows even in daylight. Several ancient leather-bound volumes sit in a tall, glass-doored bookcase resting against one wall. A large statue of a roc fills one corner of the room, a low bed shaped like a sleigh occupies the corner opposite the sculpture.

node.name: Crystal Plaza, Lobby
node.description: The ceiling here is raised three stories high with a bronzed statue of an Elothean female in the center of the room. As they move across the rust-colored tiles, the visitors' footfalls and voices echo sharply off the elaborate cornices. A listings board on the far wall has an ornate gilded frame.

node.name: Crystal Plaza, Office
node.description: Gleaming brass stanchions with velvet-lined ropes stretch across the carpeted room inside the doorway. Traders and vendors wait quietly in line to be called to the long counter with four clerks waiting behind it. Occasionally, an awaiting party is directed behind to one of the desks where they sit to discuss more intensive business.

node.name: Crystal Plaza, Rotunda
node.description: This imposing circular room is the hub of the Crystal Plaza. Arches in all directions stand between fluted pilasters on curved sandstone walls. A sculpted relief of the province of Ilithi spans the dome of brass. The golden marble floor gleams and is free of any furniture or carpet to distract from the room's beauty.

node.name: Crystal Plaza, Storage
node.description: Though piled high from floor to ceiling against each wall, boxes are stored in a neat fashion. Large stenciled numbers and letters on each give a sense of organization even if the meaning of each is not evident. A push cart with chains sits waiting in the middle of the room, probably used in the transfer of the stored wares.

node.name: Crystal Plaza, Food Court
node.description: Three low walls around each table and chairs provide the semblance of privacy. Shoppers and tradesmen carry on conversations and business deals while partaking of the food and drink set out on the carts along the wall. A solemn Elothean man keeps a careful eye on the staff that moves quietly around the room, preventing any from sneaking into the nearby shops.

node.name: Crystal Plaza, The Sea
node.description: A mural spans the room on all four walls. Starting from the northern vantage point, a bustling seaport on a bright sunny day leads to a starlit night and a solitary frigate with billowing white sails. Turning from east to south, a stylized cloud angrily blows, causing swells and massive waves curling around a clipper ship. On the western wall, a tropical beach, resplendent with palms and bright pink crabs, is deserted but for a single slanted piece of mast stuck in the sand with a tattered black flag.

node.name: Crystal Plaza, Play Yard
node.description: Brightly painted plaster mushrooms and toadstools provide wide stepping stones around the room. Straw piled high around the odd playthings creates a safe place to fall if any adventurous child loses his or her step. Small animals and fanciful fae are the perfect handholds for vaulting onto the fungi. A path of pink and blue bricks meanders through, with smaller routes leading to the entrances of the shops.

node.name: Crystal Plaza, Prism Room
node.description: Crystals of varied shapes and sizes hang from the ceiling on silver wires cut to different lengths. A light draft from channels cut at the top of the walls makes the prisms slowly twist and turn to spray the walls with color. Runners branching off a center aisle lead to the entrances of each shop.

node.name: Crystal Plaza, Oak Room
node.description: Potted palms and ferns in terracotta urns have been arranged in circle around a towering oak that rises through the ceiling in the center of the room. Curved marble benches ring the flora, providing a place for harried husbands or tired shoppers to rest. The seating also secures a vantage point for watching who is going in and out of the entries to the various shops.

node.name: Crystal Plaza, Luminous Room
node.description: Exquisite crystal glasses and bowls are showcased in niches along both long walls of the room. A central chandelier provides light that reflects off the glistening decorations. Shoppers travel leisurely in and out of the entrances to the privately-owned shops.

node.name: Seats of Plenty
node.description: Petriciu's shop is an odd affair. The walls, floor and ceiling are fashioned from thick slabs of opaque rock crystal which glow with a faint luminosity, reflecting brisk darts of light off the various enormous chairs he offers for sale. He seems to work almost exclusively in precious materials, and his handiwork is arranged around the room almost as museum pieces, such is the pride he takes in his craft.

node.name: Shard, Trader's Mercantile
node.description: Wall-length mirrors form an open, triangular trade hall, creating the illusion that the area is twice the size that it actually is. Light from the heavy brass chandelier hanging in the center of the painted ceiling illuminates a collection of fabric-covered tables provided for traders to display their wares. An ornate doorway leads back out to Moonstone Street, open regardless of the time of day.

node.name: Shard, Trader's Mercantile
node.description: Wall-length mirrors form an open, triangular trade hall, creating the illusion that the area is twice the size that it actually is. Light from the heavy brass chandelier hanging in the center of the painted ceiling illuminates a collection of fabric-covered tables provided for traders to display their wares.

node.name: Shard, Trader's Mercantile
node.description: Wall-length mirrors form an open, triangular trade hall, creating the illusion that the area is twice the size that it actually is. Light from the heavy brass chandelier hanging in the center of the painted ceiling illuminates a collection of fabric-covered tables provided for traders to display their wares.

node.name: A Grand Entrance
node.description: Samples of beautifully-constructed doors in the most fashionable and costly styles stand in neat rows around the walls of this smart shop, each flawless piece a worthy tribute to its maker's skill. A haughty salesman wanders around the store, pausing occasionally to run a manicured hand over the gleaming entrances on display.

node.name: Stormwill Tower, Entrance Hall
node.description: The entrance hall of Stormwill, unlike most other towers in Shard, is very plain and unassuming, function being more important than form to the two Guilds based here. Twin arches, on opposite sides of the hall, lead east to the Empath's Guild and west to the Infirmary. A dark stone staircase curves sinuously into the darkness overhead, leading to the areas of the Tower devoted to the Warrior Mage Guild.

node.name: Stormwill Tower, Infirmary
node.description: The Infirmary has been set up by the Empath's Guild as a courtesy to the citizens of Shard too poor to afford the services of the Hospital attendants. Staffed by some of the Guild's most gifted members, the room is filled with cabinets and drawers holding items most necessary to tending the wounded. A large plaque is set over the archway leading to the entrance hall, its bright gold sheen the most noticeable spot of color in the otherwise drab room.

node.name: Stormwill Tower, Empath Guild
node.description: The Guildmaster's office is decorated in soothing greens and blues, with splashes of gold here and there to add color. A lush white rug covers the stone floor to muffle the echoes caused by the stream of Empaths rushing in to speak with their leader, who sits behind a large mahogany desk covered in ledgers and invoices. Hung on a rod near the stone fireplace is a kettle of lemonroot tea, the Guildmaster's favorite drink.

node.name: Empath Guild, Library
node.description: Unlike most other libraries, this room contains much more than simple books and scrolls, although those can also be found on the shelf on the northern wall. Charts and diagrams hang from every inch of the wall, and lie strewn upon the tables as well, detailing the skeletal and muscular systems of the various Elanthian races. A large glass display case bears a to-scale replica of the S'Kra pelvis and tail bones, to help illustrate their fragility.

node.name: Empath's Guild, Waiting Room
node.description: Chairs line the perimeter of the room, but there is nothing to do here but wait and endure.

node.name: Empath's Guild, Examining Room
node.description: This room is one of the many set aside for triage and severe trauma arrivals. In a corner, a Paladin is gallantly trying not to cry as she keeps her arm attached to her shoulder with the help of a comrade's steady hand, and the soft crying of a father holding the battered body of his moaning son plays grim music in the background. Healers rush about anxiously, sorting out the critical from the mortally wounded, and hastily pulling sheets over those who only Urrem'tier's hand could cure.

node.name: Stormwill Tower, Basement Tunnel
node.description: Sputtering torches set in tarnished copper sconces produce the stale smoke that fills this dank tunnel with a bluish haze. The walls to either side, smeared a light shade of grey where an unfortunate apprentice has spent many an hour scrubbing, are stained a dark, smokey black across the bulk of their surfaces. Some worn granite steps lead up to the Guild proper.

node.name: Stormwill Tower, Basement Tunnel
node.description: The tunnel walls, cleaner here than the smoke-stained granite to the east, are carved with runes representing the various elemental forces controlled by members of the Warrior Mage profession. Small metal doors, each the entrance to a mage's cell, line the corridor.

node.name: Stormwill Tower, Basement Tunnel
node.description: The basement tunnel ends here at the base of an ornate, wrought-iron staircase which lead upward into a second, narrower tower hidden behind the Warrior Mage guildhall. The stairs fade from view as they spiral into the heights above.

node.name: Tower of Shadows, Earthen Gallery
node.description: The walls of this room are constructed of packed earth. Evenly-spaced doors, each the living quarters of one of the Guild's members, stare unblinkingly at the staircase that spirals down into the floor.

node.name: Tower of Shadows, Water Gallery
node.description: Stone fountains shrouded in mist burble merrily in this cool, damp gallery. The roiling mists dance off the nearby cell doors, casting rainbow patterns across their bare, spartan surfaces.

node.name: Tower of Shadows, Aether Gallery
node.description: The walls and floor of this dark, circular room seem almost insubstantial, their shadowy forms wavering from view and then reappearing in a slow, rhythmic swirl. Even the doors set into the walls sometimes shimmer and nearly disappear before coalescing again.

node.name: Tower of Shadows, Fire Gallery
node.description: Walls of illusory flame encircle the gallery with a nearly blinding light. Images dance among the flickering tongues of fire in kaleidoscopic patterns, their flames a riot of color but emitting no heat.

node.name: Tower of Shadows, Air Gallery
node.description: An open arch looks onto the roiling storm above Stormwill Tower. A skylight of etched crystal provides wan light in counterpoint to the darkness of the tempest outside. Flashes of lightning and gusts of wind batter the tower as if to hurl it from the skies.

node.name: Brickwell Tower, Courtyard
node.description: The gleaming white stone walls that surround Brickwell Tower rise high around the cobblestoned courtyard, blocking out all sounds of the city beyond save those that filter through the wrought-iron portcullis. The Tower itself is dominated by two massive white ironwood doors that stand slightly ajar. The cobblestones of the courtyard are scrubbed clean every day by a horde of servants employed for that purpose alone.

node.name: Brickwell Tower, Dispatch
node.description: The vast dispatch chamber is filled with frantic activity as caravan after caravan is quickly assembled and led out a pair of massive white ironwood doors, accompanied by the howls and complaints of those who feel they should have been first. A shipping clerk is huddled at a desk piled with a mountain of invoices, trying to keep warm as all the heat from the room is sucked out of the opening between the doors.

node.name: Brickwell Tower, Entrance Hall
node.description: The grand entrance hall of the Trader's Guild is tastefully decorated in silk rugs and tapestries created by the finest Elven weavers in the province. Twin columns, carved with images of sailing ships riding the crest of a wave, rise from the marble tiled floor. A white marble staircase which leads to the upper levels of the tower is hung with the standards of trading companies based in the city of Shard.

node.name: Brickwell Tower, The Pit
node.description: The chamber devoted to commodities trading is a hornet's nest of activity. Expensive tapestries and marble balustrades go completely unnoticed by those intent on wringing the greatest profit from their ventures. A long bench is set against the back wall for those Traders too aged to stand for great lengths of time.

node.name: Brickwell Tower, Provincial Broker
node.description: A no-nonsense businesswoman, the Provincial Broker's office is severely plain, its walls unadorned and its stone floor uncovered. In fact, the only item in the room, other than the broker herself, is a large white ironwood desk.

node.name: Brickwell Tower, Trade Minister
node.description: The trade minister's room, from the thick wall hangings to the elaborately carved desk, is decorated in shades of night. Even the stone floors have been darkened to a nearly black color, although it is impossible to tell if that was intentional, or merely the result of hundreds of Traders tramping through the door to receive their latest contract.

node.name: Brickwell Tower, Guildmaster's Office
node.description: Rich forest-green velvet draperies are pulled back to frame a woven tapestry on the teak paneled wall. Etched-glass lanterns hang from wrought iron hooks in each corner of the room. A large teak desk dominates the chamber, with a matching high-back chair the only seating provided. A battered hunter's bow hanging from a small shelf on the far wall is the only incongruous note in the decor.

node.name: Traders' Guild, Sales Returns
node.description: This small, cramped room is warm all season round due to the press of bodies that fill it. A few traders in the back handle the complaints that enter here in a neverending stream, their weary faces fixed with happy smiles. You can feel a twinge of sympathy for the poor souls who handle all that the unhappy world of customer service has to dish out, and marvel at the patience with which the clerks handle their situation.

node.name: Stairwell, Second Floor Landing
node.description: The landing is carpeted in deep royal blue rugs. A small silverwood stand rests in the middle of the landing, bearing a china vase filled with Kertigen's Treasure roses. To the west, a row of ebonwood doors provide private chambers for those Traders who cannot afford the prices of staying at an inn. Light from the open door of the Crystal Sparrow fills the hallway.

node.name: Stairwell, Third Floor Landing
node.description: The third floor landing is decorated in tasteful shades of green, from the forest carpeting to the sea-foam paneling on the walls. A small white oak stand, inlaid with gold seashells, bears a crystal vase filled with Eluned's Tears.

node.name: Brickwell Tower, Lounge
node.description: The guild lounge, the walls paneled in cherrywood and the floors covered by a thick red carpet, is a place for guildmembers to relax and talk away from the driving concerns of profit. Dominated by a huge oak bookcase, the room is filled with an air of calm relaxation, reinforced by the flickering light from the marble fireplace.

node.name: Brickwell Tower, Watersong Suite
node.description: A cunning network of pipes runs along the ceiling of the room, carefully hidden behind the same blue silk draping that covers the walls and the surface of the large four-poster bed in the center of the room. As water runs through the pipes, they vibrate with a low hum. Each pipe has a different tone, creating a virtual symphony of glorious song.

node.name: Brickwell Tower, Stargazer's Loft
node.description: A large glass dome surrounds the top of Brickwell tower, providing privacy for those who wish to be alone to gaze at the glory of the heavens above. A large black stone fireplace rests at one end of the loft, filling the room with warmth. Covered in black silk sheets sprinkled with bits of silver, a large bed rests near the fireplace.

node.name: Brickwell Tower, Rosemist Suite
node.description: Covered in thick silver-grey carpet, the floor of the Rosemist Suite feels like the fantasy of walking on a cloud. Vases filled with the rare variety of Watermist roses, those that grow only at the base of waterfalls, are scattered about the room, filling the suite with their gentle fragrance. A large bed covered in grey silk sheets rests in the center of the room, its surface strewn with blushing pink rose petals.

node.name: The Great Tower, Courtyard North
node.description: A softly glowing light filters in from the east, while deep shadows blot out the view to the west. The delicately sweet perfume of night-blooming flowers and the gentle splash of fountains weaves its way through the air, harmonious and soothing. A set of crystal globes filled with a luminescent mist illuminates the sweeping marble archway to the north leading back to Diamond Street. The base of the Great Tower dominates the view to the south, its main entrance eternally open.

The musical splash of a fountain echoes through the courtyard from the east and west, while the perfume of constantly upkept plants and flowering vines floating with the sound through the air. A sweeping marble archway to the north leads back to Diamond Street. The base of the Great Tower dominates the view to the south, its main entrance eternally open.

node.name: The Great Tower, Garden of Shadows
node.description: Thorny black rose bushes and flowering purple lilacs decorate this dense and shadowy garden. Only a good set of hedge clippers and a careful gardener have kept the path from becoming overgrown. The only brightness in the dark foliage is the single cherry tree, dropping white petals like snowflakes.

node.name: The Great Tower, Courtyard West
node.description: Small blue pebbles have been embedded in the path that leads north and south around the Great Tower and west through a glittering crystal archway leading to Moonstone Street. Closer examination reveals that tiny black moon-shaped carvings have been captured in the glass of the stones, floating amidst a sea of hard sapphire.

node.name: The Great Tower, Garden of Serenity
node.description: Several feet of ground have been cordoned off and covered with carefully raked sand in this part of the courtyard. Torches on wrought iron poles light the rocks that have apparently been placed randomly on the sand. Stone benches around the arrangement allow it to be viewed from a variety of angles. A guard stands watch over the garden.

Several feet of ground have been cordoned off and covered with carefully raked sand in this part of the courtyard. Rocks have apparently been placed randomly on the sand, and benches have been set about the area. A guard stands watch over the garden, assuring that no one tampers with its arrangement.

node.name: The Great Tower, Courtyard South
node.description: The softly gleaming silver Great Tower eats up most of the ground of this darkened cobbled courtyard. Twin globes of crystal illuminate the south entrance to the Great Tower, catching on the armor of the tower's guards. A thicket of trees can be glimpsed to the east, and a curious rock formation silhouette catches the eye to the west.

The gleaming silver Great Tower eats up most of the ground of this small, cobbled courtyard. Guards flank the south entrance to the Great Tower, their plate gleaming and their shields at the ready. A thicket of trees can be glimpsed to the east, and a curious formation of rocks catches the eye to the west.

node.name: The Great Tower, Kukalakai's Grove
node.description: Shadows have dimmed the silvery beauty of the precious ban-minahle trees that grow here, softening the metallic sheen on the leaves to a moonlit glow. Tiny lights flicker through the air, vanishing and reappearing as they dart beneath the leaves, just barely illuminating the presence of a narrow tunnel leading through the trees to a dim glade.

A thicket of precious ban-minahle trees grow in a small and well-groomed clump here, their silvery, lirum coin-sized leaves shimmering in a lakeside breeze that causes them to make a soft fluttering sound reminescent to chimes. A rich carpet of emerald green grass pads the ground, and a narrow tunnel leads through the trees into a dim glade.

node.name: The Great Tower, Courtyard East
node.description: Squares of limestone the color of pale lapis lazuli split into a path that leads northward toward the sound of a fountain and southward to a stand of dark trees. A gentle perfumed breeze wafts from north to south, surrounding the graceful ash arch that leads into this section of the courtyard of the Great Tower.

Big, showy white flowers bloom on the dark green camellia bushes at the base of the tower, fronted by a narrow carpet of brightly striped coleus. A flagstone path through the flower beds leads south to a stand of dark trees and north from where the sound of splashing water can be heard.

Yellow daffodils and purple crocuses bloom in front of dark green camellia bushes at the base of the tower. A flagstone path through the flower beds leads south to a stand of dark trees and north from where the sound of splashing water can be heard.

node.name: The Great Tower, Garden of Lights
node.description: Rings of vibrant colors glow from the bottom of the water-filled pool that lies just off the path winding through this sedate garden. The light illuminates the trunks and boughs of the half-circle of weeping silverwillows that rings the pool and glances off the thick, glossy leaves of the ivy that climbs over the walls and grounds.

A circular pool ringed partially with weeping silverwillows lies just off the path that winds through this sedate garden of honeysuckle, succulent ivy, and morning glories. Water shoots up out of the center of the pool, falling down in a fan of droplets that sparkle in the light. The lights for which this garden was named do not actually become apparent until after dark.

node.name: The Great Tower, Entryway
node.description: Walls of gleaming white marble sweep like seagull's wings in a wide, massive circle. A tile mosaic of dark material is embedded in the floor, the type of substance that releases a most satisfying *click* when walked across wearing metal-shod boots. A short passage leads east, and there is a narrow corridor northwest. Gleaming mahogany doors lead west, and a spiral stairway allows access to other levels.

node.name: The Great Tower, Debt Collector's Office
node.description: Dimly lit by a tiny crystal globe on a polished oak desk, this office is neat and tidy by nature of necessity -- the necessity in this case being the room's small size. A locked box has been bolted into the ground next to the desk, an effort to keep the honest workers here honest. Though no vents or open windows can be detected in any of the convex walls, there is a fresh breeze drifting through the air, flushing out the stale scent of money.

node.name: The Great Tower, Chamber of Voices
node.description: This room is a touch chilly despite the red carpet that has been laid down on the floor. Aisles of polished wooden benches allow for around seventy Human adults to sit in comfortably. A raised dais occupies the rear of the room, an ornate podium rising up in front of it.

node.name: The Great Tower, Sentinel's Office
node.description: Three gleaming desks create an open-ended rectangle here, one for each of the patrol leaders of Shard. A glass display case holds the names of the criminals foolish enough to have attracted the attention of the elite watchmen of the city. A painting of the Ferdahl hangs over the doorway, some words written in gold ink beneath her face on the frame.

node.name: The Great Tower, Chamber of Justice
node.description: Banners representing every Elothean house hang from the ceiling, and one massive one of the House of the Steel Dove serve as the backdrop for the justiciar's dais at the far back of the room. No forms of seating can be seen in all the chamber, a gesture that implies one should not loiter here long.

node.name: The Great Tower, Stairwell
node.description: Cool and quiet, the walls of this small stairwell encourage silence and decorum. A short passage to the south leads to the central library of Shard, the largest repository of books, scrolls and manuscripts in Ilithi.

node.name: The Great Tower, Library Cellar
node.description: Crystal globes have been imbedded in the ceiling, and cast a steady light for the readers who use Shard for their research. Shelves of gleaming rosewood hold the treasures of scholars, and a lack of windows imparts the sense of timelessness that any good library conveys.

node.name: The Great Tower, Stairwell
node.description: Cool and quiet, the walls of this small stairwell close in tightly -- a claustrophobic's nightmare. Steps lead up to the next level and down to the main entrance. A door on the south wall allows entry to the rest of this part of the tower.

node.name: The Great Tower, Stairwell
node.description: Cool and quiet, the walls of this small stairwell close in tightly -- a claustrophobic's nightmare. Steps lead up to the next level and down to the museum level. A door on the south wall allows entry to the rest of this part of the tower.

node.name: The Great Tower, Stairwell
node.description: Cool and quiet, the walls of this small stairwell close in tightly -- a claustrophobic's nightmare. Steps lead up to the next level and down to the Corridor of Power. A door on the south wall allows entry to the rest of this part of the tower.

node.name: The Great Tower, Stairwell
