node.description: Cool and quiet, the walls of this small stairwell close in tightly -- a claustrophobic's nightmare. Steps lead up to the next level and down to the chambers of the Ferdahl.

node.name: Moon Mage Guild, Aviary Stair
node.description: An ivory-banistered staircase, the steps paved with black-veined marble, opens up here onto the floor of a vast aviary. The Elanthian sky is visible through an atrium ceiling far overhead, the roof of the Great Tower set with panes of nearly invisible crystal. Ringed by somber pillars, a wide marble walkway circumnavigates the aviary and opens up onto a number of side passages. A golden plaque is set into the floor.

node.name: Moon Mage Guild, Western Walkway
node.description: A marble walk encircles the open aviary to the east, the sounds of fluttering wings and musical bird-calls warbling through the humid air. A tall archway opens to the northwest, and beyond it can be seen tall ironwood shelves lined with books.

node.name: Moon Mage Guild, Aviary
node.description: Rare and exotic plants and trees stretch up from the soft loam of the aviary, nesting-places for tropical birds imported to the guild from many lands. They soar from tree to tree and wheel through the air beneath the crystal skylights above, their bodies hued in every color of the rainbow.

node.name: Moon Mage Guild, Eastern Walkway
node.description: This marble walkway encircles the open aviary to the west, the occasional student or elder mage quietly walking through. An archway opens onto a short hallway to the southeast, and this walk curves around to the southwest and northwest.

node.name: Moon Mage Guild, Short Hallway
node.description: Barely ten feet long, this brief walk connects to the vast open chamber to the northwest, and opens onto smaller rooms to the northeast and southwest. It ends in a sheer crystal wall, looking out over the city of Shard far below.

node.name: Moon Mage Guild, Funeral Chamber
node.description: Set in the center of this rounded chamber, a sarcophagus of glistening limestone has been set out beneath the skylights far above. Its lid is made of fine crystal so its occupant can, in some fashion, continue to watch the stars. A golden plaque is set into the floor at the sarcophagus' base.

node.name: Moon Mage Guild, Atrium
node.description: The skylights curve down like a canopy over this small chamber, enclosing the northeastern hemisphere in a bubble of translucent, glittering crystal. A polished bronze telescope is here for students of the stars, but most visitors come just for the breathtaking view. From here, one can see for miles past the towers and streets of Shard, all the way to the walls of Leth Deriel in the far distance.

node.name: Moon Mage Guild, Northern Walkway
node.description: This marble walkway encircles the open aviary to the south, running around to the southwest and southeast. To the far south you can see the staircase leading down into the Great Tower, and an open archway leads north.

node.name: Moon Mage Guild, Library
node.description: To protect the rare books here from the rays of the sun, a smooth marble canopy stretches over this clammy chamber. Dark ironwood shelves stretch from floor to ceiling, their contents illuminated by softly glowing magical sconces on the walls. Finely-carved tables and desks are scattered through the room, where scholars work dilligently at all hours.

node.name: Moon Mage Guild, Maze Entrance
node.description: An odd mist swirls an inch above the ground of this small, dimly lit room. Above, an unseen lightsource creates more shadows than it illuminates, painting the room hundreds of varying shades of grey. A dark portal, guarded by a young woman in the white robes of Meraud, is cut into the north wall and leads into the maze.

node.name: Moon Mage Guild, Guildmaster's Chamber
node.description: Tropical birds nest in marble creches flanking this wide hall, sometimes fluttering through the air beneath the crystal skylights far above. Soft harp music can faintly be heard in the air, and a gentle breeze carries the scent of pears and pineapples. A silver dais sits at the head of the hall, a throne for the city's Moon Mage guildleader.

node.name: Garden of Lights, Gazebo
node.description: Deep shadows wrap this hexagonal-shaped gazebo, draping down from the roof in the form of bougainvillea vines. Padded benches and a living curtain of thickly growing honeysuckle ivy that weaves a latticework of privacy completes the sense of removal from the weary world. Soft light blooms up from time to time from the garden beyond, warm and gentle.

Light pink bougainvillea flowers wrap around this hexagonal-shaped gazebo, draping down from the roof to drop soft, papery petals to the wooden floor. Padded benches and a living curtain of thickly growing honeysuckle ivy that weaves in with the bougainvillea vines complete the total sense of removal from the world that lies beyond this small, dim enclosure.

node.name: Kukalakai's Grove, Dim Glade
node.description: Secluded and shaded by a circle of ban-minahle trees, this is the perfect place for contemplating deep thoughts -- which may be why it was the Lady Kukalakai's favorite place to do exactly that. Thick grass grows up around a ring of benches in the center of the glade, and the vaguest hint of honeysuckle drifts through the air. The quiet twittering of wrens completes the sense of relaxation. Here even the over-agitated can be content to simply be.

node.name: Province of Ilithi, Citizenship Office
node.description: Marble flooring, dark wood paneling, silk drapery and leather chairs give the office a veneer of elegance. A cut-crystal chandelier protruding from the center of the ceiling shimmers with dangling faceted drops. Beneath it, there is an ornately carved desk which is home to the sole visible personal item: a handsome wooden frame.

node.name: Shard, Thieves' Guild
node.description: The sound of rough laughter and boisterous conversation echoes through a broad stone archway leading into the main guild sitting room. Opposite the arch stands the door out into the street, flanked by a pair of bright torches. A bored looking guard sits in a chair by the door, fiddling with his knife.

node.name: Demiciil's Armory
node.description: A showcase of wood and glass runs the length of this room around the east, west, and north walls. Gleaming helms and pieces of armor hang from the wall, rest behind the glass of the showcase, or off of hangers that are arranged all about the store. The powerful figure of Demiciil, the shop's owner, dominates the back where he stands with arms folded across his chest, watching everyone carefully.

node.name: Shard, Cleric's Guild
node.description: The traceried black stone floor here is inlaid with silver in the form of words. Wooden pegs line the walls where various cloaks and clerical vestments hang in safety. Faint incense wafts about, tickling your nose with soft fragrances. The silver and the dark portals set into the south wall shimmer and pulsate, each giving off an odd glow.

node.name: Shard, Hall of Enlightenment
node.description: This hall is wide, plastered stone, and roofed by an arched ceiling. Heavy wooden beams form arches every few feet. Clerics can be seen walking the hall, stopping every few feet to recite prayers, before moving on.

node.name: Shard, Library of Light and Dark
node.description: Books, codices and scrolls litter the dusty shelves lining the walls. Benches and soft chairs along with stools of all heights provide engrossed readers with resting areas as they peruse their texts. Acolytes and clerics can be seen, reading the ancient books on lore and religion.

node.name: Shard, Hall of Solace
node.description: The stillness of this chamber settles like heavy fog clutching the ground. There are no furnishings here. The wooden floor is carved and painted with simple geometric designs. Long narrow windows pierce the southern wall. Near each window rests a tallow candle in a wall sconce.

node.name: Stairwell, Second Floor Landing
node.description: The dark stone staircase briefly halts its upward journey here at a small landing. A brilliantly-colored green and gold patterned rug covers the stone floor of the landing, its surface slightly marred by the muddy tracks of a large cat. A large tapestry hangs upon the wall, its surface depicting the aspects of Meraud.

node.name: Stairwell, Third Floor Landing
node.description: The third floor landing is devoted to the Warrior Mage's eternal companion: his familiar. Statues and tapestries depict the countless varieties of familiars, from lizard to dolphin and beyond. An arch to the east leads to the familiar infirmary, where Mages can tend their companions if they become wounded in battle.

node.name: Stairwell, Fourth Floor Landing
node.description: The portion of the winding staircase that led up to the rooftop has been shattered beyond repair. All that remains are a few fragments of stone that lie scattered about the landing. A large glass window which once filled the room with light, is now obscured by a fog or mist outside the tower.

node.name: Stormwill Tower, Barracks
node.description: The Guild barracks is dimly lit, the only source of light being what can filter through a large casement window on the western wall, and the mist beyond. Rows of thinly padded cots and small chests fill the room, provided for the use of junior members of the Guild, or those too poor or avoidable to have a place of their own to stay.

node.name: Stormwill Tower, Infirmary
node.description: Since most familiars are too sensible to allow their Mage to perform major surgery on them, the small room set off the third floor landing only contains the bare necessities to prevent bleeding. Cabinets filled with medical bandages and flat wooden boards for splints line the walls. A large stone table, its surface lightly stained with blood, rests in the center of the room for those familiars small enough to fit upon it.

node.name: Stormwill Tower, Hall of Knowledge
node.description: Shaped like a hexagon, the Warrior Mage Guild's library is devoted to instructing members on the history of the Guild, as well as the arcane uses of their power. Each of the six walls is covered in a mural inspired by one of the elements. A stand of dark ebonwood holds many volumes of written lore, a treasure for all Mages.

node.name: Stormwill Tower, Cloudwalk West
node.description: A portion of the cloud which surrounds Stormwill has solidified into a narrow walkway that circles the tower. The mist looks as fragile as the rest of the cloud, yet seems sturdy enough to support a Gor'Tog in full plate armor. Leading back into the tower is a small casement window, the only way to access the cloudwalk.

node.name: Stormwill Tower, Cloudwalk South
node.description: Where the other areas of the cloudwalk are sturdy as the ground itself, portions here have begun to weaken and dissipate. The rest of the cloud is thicker than ever, its dark mass churning and rumbling as air currents sweep through it.

node.name: Stormwill Tower, Cloudwalk East
node.description: The mist ledge broadens dramatically at the eastern side of the tower. A small flight of stairs, each step made of the same mist as the ledge, leads up to the top of the tower. The stormcloud rumbles and crackles threateningly above.

node.name: Stormwill Tower, Cloudwalk North
node.description: The narrow ledge of mist continues wrapping around the tower, barely wide enough to sidle along. A small gap in the mist provides a bird's-eye view of the city far, far below.

node.name: Eye of the Storm
node.description: The top of Stormwill Tower, as well as its highest floor, is completely enshrouded in a massive stormcloud which never dissipates or moves from its position. Created years ago by a half-mad mage drunk with power, the storm is now a permanent fixture of the Tower. Each Guildmaster devotes every waking moment to keeping the storm in check, preventing it from growing large enough to destroy the city. A small flight of stairs, shaped from the very substance of the storm, leads down to the cloudwalk.

node.name: Shard, Smuggler's Bridge
node.description: Calls from the guards above echo down to a narrow strip of sand beneath the soaring walls of Shard. The river laps quietly at this beach, marked heavily by footprints leading right into the water. The prints head toward a sandbar rising barely above the surface about fifty feet out.

node.name: Spires of Glory, Salesroom
node.description: All around are the trappings of opulence, from the crystal chandelier overhead to the plush black carpet that softens the floor. The proprietor of this shop seems to be most interested in providing comfort for the clientele, while at the same time displaying the wares for sale in a most pleasant surrounding. Resting in a semi-circle around the room are several divans, waiting to offer relaxation to weary shoppers.

node.name: Vaalrin House, Grand Foyer
node.description: Sunlight spills down into the room from the domed skylight far overhead, bathing the impressive collection of rare blooms that occupy the periphery of the foyer. The vines of climbing plants have been allowed to entwine the elegant columns that buttress the high roof, lifting the greenery high above the marble floors. A small artful waterfall and pond fills the space between a split marble staircase leading to the balcony above.

node.name: Vaalrin House, Duph's Taproom
node.description: The taproom is smoky, dimly lit by lanterns hung upon the walls, and the heavy beams that support the floor above are low enough to make a Gor'Tog duck when entering. Still, the room is kept clean, right down to the scarred but patiently cared for hardwood floor. Opposite the bar, a cozy fire crackles merrily in the soapstone fireplace beneath an old oil painting.

node.name: Vaalrin House, Foyer Balcony
node.description: Thick red woolen rugs with interweaving patterns of blue and green cover the marble floor of the balcony all the way from the intricately wrought iron railings to the tapestries that hang against the back wall. Busts of several notable citizens of years past perch atop alabaster pedestals along the length of the wall, flanking both sides of a wide arch.

node.name: Vaalrin House, Drawing Room
node.description: Dominating the room is a heavy mahogany table surrounded by several high-backed chairs, placed here for smaller semi-formal gatherings. Panels of dark wood cover the walls on one side of the room while a set of leaded glass windows framed by heavy draperies fronts the street on the other. A large rough-cut granite fireplace next to a suit of armor at one end of the room contains a low fire to keep any chills out of the room.

node.name: Vaalrin House, Spire Ballroom
node.description: A gorgeous parquet dance floor stretches the entire width of the building, flanked on either side by tall windows letting in the daylight that gives the wood floor a honey-colored glow. At the far end of the room, a long buffet table stands ready to refresh the guests of the house beneath a large gold framed painting of the great tower. Hanging above the dance floor is a crystal and silver chandelier, dazzling the eye even though it remains unlit during the day.

node.name: A Flawless Facade
node.description: A stunning mosaic of flagstones in a variety of colors, textures and finishes lines the walls and floor of this enormous showroom. Standing at regular intervals around the room, abstract arrangements of high-quality building materials contribute an artistic flair to the unusual but appealing decor, transforming the store into a veritable architectural art gallery.

node.name: Painted Ladies Design
node.description: Buckets of paint and white canvas dropcloths streaked with colorful spatters lie neatly piled in the corners of the shop, while paint brushes wrapped in paper hang drying upon the walls. A cast iron tub in the corner is used to mix paint as workmen make ready to start a job. In the center of the room, a sign welcomes you to Painted Ladies Design.

node.name: Painted Ladies Design, the Green Room
node.description: Deep green ferns dangle from polished brass chains along the green sponge-painted walls. Ruddy mahogany frames hang at evenly spaced intervals, displaying an assortment of paint styles available for sale. In one corner, a neatly-dressed young Elven woman stands ready to take your order.

node.name: Painted Ladies Design, the Yellow Room
node.description: Light streams from ivory sconces hanging at even intervals along the sunny yellow walls. The dark frames which display samples of the painters' work are a vivid contrast to the pastel toned plaster. In one corner, a sprightly Elven woman stands ready to take your order.

node.name: Painted Ladies Design, the Peach Room
node.description: A deep green vase filled with vivid orange tropical flowers stands in the center of a polished satinwood table at the far end of the room. The walls are a pale shade of peach, hung with mahogany frames displaying samples of the shop's work. A young Elven woman lounges carelessly on a chair in the corner, notepad in hand as she waits to take your order.

node.name: Painted Ladies Design, the Red Room
node.description: Soft pink walls surround a dark ebony-trimmed oak floor, giving a flattering glow to the complexion in the candlelight. Bouquets of roses hang in vases along the wall, between framed samples of the painter's work. In the corner, a young Elven woman sits behind a counter waiting to take your order.

node.name: Painted Ladies Design, the Violet Room
node.description: Tiny glazed clay pots filled with moss and deep violet pansies sit in wrought iron hangers. Draped with silk hangings in shades of purple and ivory, the walls hold silverwillow frames displaying samples of the shop's work for customers to peruse. Behind a counter, a young Elven woman sits, her hands folded as she waits to take your order.

node.name: Painted Ladies Design, the White Room
node.description: Silvery silk is draped against a flocked white-on-white paper along the walls of the display room. Dark ebony frames surround samples of the shop's work, and a young Elven woman looks up alertly as you enter, waiting to take your order.

node.name: Painted Ladies Design, the Gold Room
node.description: Pale ivory walls have been hung with shimmering garlands of sheer golden silk for an ethereal effect. The soft light of candles standing upon cherrywood tables only heightens the effect. Display cases mounted along the walls provide samples of the painter's work, and a young Elven woman awaits your order.

node.name: Painted Ladies Design, the Blue Room
node.description: The room is decorated in shades of white, blue and gold, with samples of paint styles and wallpaper framed upon the walls. A young Elven woman stands behind the counter, ready to take your order.

node.name: House of the Waxen Moons, Entrance
node.note: House of the Waxen Moons|Waxen Moons
node.description: This large hallway is slightly curved and has a rather high ceiling, well lit with pale blue oil lanterns mounted on the wall. A dark red carpet runs down the center of the hallway, covering a rich black marble floor shot through with gold veins. A small plant in a vase the same color as the carpet has been tucked into the corner, opposite the door leading back to the streets of Shard.

node.name: House of the Waxen Moons, Foyer
node.description: Dark red carpeting runs down the center of the long hallway, covering a polished black marble floor. Occupying much of the northern half of the room is a large mahogany desk, its clean surface following the wall. Next to the desk is an arched walnut door leading further into the House. A small sitting room is visible through a small arch at the northwest end of this hall.

node.name: House of the Waxen Moons, Sitting Room
node.description: Overstuffed suede couches frame a low table set with a small tray of tea and other refreshments. Dark purple curtains line each corner of the room, though the off-white walls have no windows at all. Lit with two small oil lanterns hanging from the low ceiling, the room has a serene feeling, and holds the scent of brewed tea and tobacco.

node.name: House of the Floating Reed, Entrance
node.note: House of the Floating Reed|Floating Reed
node.description: Split bamboo lined up vertically and bound together by grass cord makes up the walls of this wide hallway. Clever painting on the ceiling mimics oversized leaves, with several fresh branches tied on the long vertical posts that hold up the ceiling. A low railing to the north overlooks a slow-moving pool, which fills the air with the gentle sound of flowing water.

node.name: House of the Floating Reed, Statue
node.description: The walkway ends here, with a maple wood balcony overlooking a large body of slow-moving water to the northeast. A wooden statue stands in the outer corner, depicting a willowy dryad holding a large tray of fruit. Roughly hewn posts twined with white ivy from floor to ceiling have been set at periodic intervals down the hall's length. Through a few tall stalks of leafy bamboo, a well-tended garden can be seen to the north.

node.name: House of the Floating Reed, West Garden
node.description: A narrow bed of earth wends its way along the west side of the small indoor garden, its curving edge lined with burnished stones. Interspersed around the base of a large raspberry bush are sweet-smelling sprigs of white lilac and milady's lace. Twin jade statues stand on either side of a winding bridge that crosses over the tranquil water to the east, while to the north a set of glass doors leads into a ballroom.

node.name: House of the Floating Reed, Banquet Hall
node.description: Square pots have been set at either side of a break in the balcony railing, both carved from a pale jade. Each is planted with a line of bamboo shoots in standing water, the thin stalks blooming into leaves in various shades of green. Laid out with a spread of elegant dishes, a carved silverwood table sits opposite a set of narrow steps leading into a wide pool.

node.name: House of the Floating Reed, Balcony
node.description: Painted onto the wooden floor of the balcony is the image of a black water serpent, its long body seamlessly merging into a stone statue that coils around one of the balcony's wooden posts. Set in the corner of the room is a small glass case displayed underneath a small lantern. The balcony ends here, and to the north is a small, well-tended garden.

node.name: House of the Floating Reed, East Garden
node.description: Along the east side of the garden is a well-mulched bed of earth, edged with carved silverwood. Planted with dragon's mouth orchids and firefall vines, a heady scent comes from the blooming plants. Dim twilight filters through a large skylight, and underneath it is a small fountain made of shaped kokona reeds. Twin jade lions frame a narrow winding bridge to the west, while a bamboo door to the north leads into a small shop.

Along the east side of the room is a wide garden bed, edged with carved silverwood. Planted with dragon's mouth orchids and firefall vines, a heady scent comes from the blooming plants. Dim twilight filters through a large skylight, and underneath it is a small fountain made of shaped kokona reeds. Twin jade lions frame a narrow winding bridge to the west, while a bamboo door to the north leads into a small shop.

node.name: House of the Floating Reed, Winding Bridge
node.description: Painted in a pure white, the narrow bridge goes neatly over the large square-shaped pool. Two sharp bends in the middle of the bridge house a low mistwood bench between them. Schools of fish swim about lazily in the water below, perhaps waiting for food from overhead. The air is filled with a rather tranquil mist, dampening the open sky above.

node.name: House of the Floating Reed, Shop
node.description: Walls of split, polished bamboo enclose the low-ceilinged room, a low shelf hung on the western wall. Wares for sale are spread out on a long silverwood table, and a wide rack has been hung with an array of brightly colored skirts. A small sign has been posted on the wall of the shop, and a bamboo door leads back out to the garden.

node.name: House of the Steel Dove
node.note: House of the Steel Dove|Steel Dove
node.description: Sanded black deobar planks line the floor to form a procession that leads to a single flint slab in the center of the room. The walls are made from a dark grey wood, the material also used to craft the spare benches set along the sides. A thick arch leads further into the building.

node.name: Shard, Basement
node.description: This large cellar looks like a storeroom: stacks of crates, some bearing the Traders' Guild emblem, wrapped canvas bundles, and barrels of liquor are arranged in neat piles against the walls. A dark doorway in the southern wall leads into a narrow tunnel.

node.name: Undershard, Tunnels
node.description: The fissure widens slightly into a narrow passage, one that has obviously been worked, but not by skilled hands. The walls are rough and badly chipped, and the floor is covered with fragments of stone that make the footing treacherous.

node.name: Shard, Thieves' Guild
node.description: The main guild hall has more of a tavern atmosphere than anything professional. Rough wooden tables seat a crowd of rowdy, boisterous guild members, ably served by the innkeeper Talthus. The walls are hung with costly tapestries and art, obviously spoils donated by the guild members. A long wooden bar covers the entire eastern wall, and behind it stand shelves stocked with the best of drinks. A doorway in the southern wall leads further into the guild, opposite the archway back to the street.

node.name: Thieves' Guild, Office
node.description: The guildmaster's office is garishly decorated with trophies and prizes from a long and successful career. Expensive tapestries of velvet, silk and cloth of gold hang from the walls, clashing with the thick embroidered rug covering the floor. A mismatched drink service of silver and gold studded with gems sits atop a carved ebony sideboard against one wall. The only functional piece in the room is a simple pine desk piled high with papers in the center of the room.

node.name: Thieves' Guild, Masters' Lounge
node.description: Decorative veils of shimmering gold silk hang from the walls and ceiling, making this lavishly decorated chamber look more like a wealthy trader's caravan tent than an underground room. Soft velvet pillows sit in piles along the wall, atop a thick velvet carpet sewn with gold thread. A sweet smelling smoke rises from an incense jar sitting in the center of a low wooden table in the middle of the room.

node.name: Thieves' Guild, Workshop
node.description: Exquisitely crafted maple shelves are set above tall marble topped counters. A deep marble sink, surmounted by a solid brass water pump, shares one wall with a white porcelain stove. A stone gargoyle, wings furled and its gaping jaws ready to serve as a waste disposal, sits conveniently near an unlonchai bucket. The clever use of mirrors brings sunlight to a Wayerd pyramid tucked into a niche in the wall.

node.name: The Great Tower, Antechamber
node.description: Large cushions of plush, deep purple pile in the corners of this small room, ready to provide seating should the wait for admittance to the Ferdahl's inner chambers be a long one. Twin gaethzen orbs frame both entrances, the pale, steady light lending a feeling of warmth to the red-violet walls that enclose the chamber. A small indigo rug sits to the side of the door, hosting an array of soft slippers.

node.name: The Great Tower, Narrow Hall
node.description: Floors of dark walnut gleam in the light cast by a row of standing lamps. The plastered walls, painted a bright scarlet, are decorated by tightly spiraled white patterns that maze across their curved surfaces. The violet furnishings of the antechamber are visible through a curtained arch, while across from it stands a pair of large teak doors.

node.name: The Great Tower, Narrow Hall
node.description: A miniature potted cherry tree flourishes here despite the lack of natural light, coating the walnut floor surrounding it with a snowfall of delicate pink blossoms. Across from it opens an ash archway, its surface carved with a flowered vine motif to match the standing lamps that curve out of sight with the rest of the hall.

node.name: The Great Tower, Narrow Hall
node.description: Off to one side stands a spidery table, its cloth dyed in a rainbow of colors. A long mural painted on creamy ricepaper stretches above, the black shapes splashed upon it looking alien and vaguely menacing in the muted lamplight. Closer inspection, however, reveals them to be nothing more intimidating than a highly stylized landscape of the Dragon's Spine.

node.name: Chambers of the Ferdahl, Antechamber
node.description: Pale marble walls carved with a stylized pattern of curled vines and flowers enclose this quiet waiting room. About the perimeter, cushioned silverwillow benches fashioned in a graceful bentwood style have been placed for the comfort of those arriving early for a private audience. Underfoot, scattered rugs in muted tones of blue and green soften the bleached limestone floor, and in the western wall, arched windows allow daylight to spill in, dimming the gaethzen lamps that occupy the corners.

node.name: Chambers of the Ferdahl, Wash Room
node.description: Bright blue tiles cover the floor of this small room, ending at the foot of a large bowl-shaped white porcelain basin. A complicated arrangement of twisted copper pipes snakes beneath it, winding up and around to end in a pair of gleaming taps. Above, an oval mirror hangs on a wall decorated by stylized cresting waves. The opposite wall is dominated by an arched window, bordered by light white curtains.

node.name: Chambers of the Ferdahl, Meeting Room
node.description: Massive windows in the western wall offer a panoramic view of the distant mountains as they allow daylight to flood this airy room. Dark green damask draperies are drawn back and tied with braided silk cords, and in the center of the room stands a heavy pedestal table surrounded by straight-backed wooden chairs. A gaethzen lamp in a plain bronze stand sits upon the table, ready for the coming of night.

node.name: Chambers of the Ferdahl, Sitting Room
node.description: Although windowless, this room is bright with the clear light of gaethzen lamps reflecting off of the white limestone floor and walls. Set at intervals about the room, panels of glass mosaic like fractured rainbows catch the eye, and in one corner a pierced and hammered censer contains a slow-burning, spicy incense. Low ottomans and cushioned armchairs provide comfortable seating, while a brightly painted silk screen bars passage elsewhere.

node.name: The Great Tower, Narrow Hall
node.description: The brilliant patterned scarlet of the walls is broken here by a stretch of black silk curtains that veil the outline of an open archway. Beside them, a bright copperwood stand houses a large book which is laid open to reveal a pair of blank pages. Long paintings span the hallway, done in stark greys and blacks on creamy white paper.

node.name: The Great Tower, Hall of Feasts
node.description: High, curving walls arch upward in the muted light, meeting to form the domed ceiling of this great chamber. At the apex stretches a chandelier so skillfully spun from gaethzen and glass that it resembles a spider's web, dew-coated and cradling the stars. Thin marble pillars, also studded with gaethzen, form a wide circle, and between them rest long tables rimmed by benches.

node.name: The Great Tower, Hall of Dances
node.description: A semicircle of tall daylily-shaped lamps wraps around the perimeter of the dance floor, the flickering light lending an almost cozy atmosphere to the area. Large screens painted with fantastic beasts and impossible landscapes line all but the southernmost wall, which is broken by a large archway leading back to the dining hall's more formal setting.

node.name: The Great Tower, Hall of Dances
node.description: Given a warm orange cast by the natural lamplight, the ebonwood floor gleams underfoot, with a polished surface unblemished by careless bootmarks. Beyond a sweeping archway cut into the north wall, the great chandelier of the Hall of Feasts can be seen, its glittering expanse partially dimmed by a thin veil of curtains.

node.name: Hall of Audiences, Seating Area
node.description: Long benches of white marble gleam in the daylight that streams though the glass panels of the lotus-shaped skylight set in the domed ceiling. The benches coil most of the way around this large, circular chamber, forming rows that descend gradually, ending a short distance away from the raised dais upon which the Ferdahl holds her audiences. The soft blue-green color of the chamber lends the area a further feeling of tranquility.

node.name: Milene's Rose, Stables
node.description: The gleaming gold of hay and the soft whuffling of stabled horses and pack animals composes the bulk of the stable. The floor is strewn with bits of straw, and a pitchfork leans against the wall at the end of the aisle that runs between the stalls.

node.name: Empath Guild, Whitehall Commons
node.description: Dark beige tapestries edged in midnight blue hush the corridor to a thick, soft silence, and plush carpeting with earthy brown tones adds to the air of serenity. To one side of the hall stands a narrow modwir door, and a simple wooden arch leads northward into a courtyard.

node.name: Whitehall Commons, Herbal Gardens
node.description: Long stretches of well-tended plants line the center of the courtyard, and small rose bushes grow in the corners of the garden square. Framing the area, wide pathways of crushed white marble accommodate several benches for entertaining company or simply for a moment of quiet reflection.

node.name: Whitehall Commons, Path of Charity
node.description: A large bronze urn sits to one side of the path as it runs between lines of low boxwoods and luxuriant lilacs. Opposite the urn, an elegant bronze statue stands on a polished linden base, the life-size sculpture depicting an Elven woman in simple, flowing robes.

node.name: Whitehall Commons, Way of Renewal
node.description: The crushed white marble pathway curves through a small grove of apple trees, with tiny seedlings scattered among mature trees and aged, twisted patriarchs. Grass grows lushly between the trees, forming lawns perfect for picnics or simply sinking bare toes into.

node.name: Whitehall Commons, Path of Devotion
node.description: A verdigrised copper lattice arches over the pathway bearing vines thick with dangling clusters of modwyn berries. Their fruity scent joins with the pungent aroma of healing herbs hanging heavy in the air, drifting up from neatly planted gardens outside each home.

node.name: Whitehall Commons, Fountain of Healing
node.description: Small dwellings cluster about an ivory fountain topped with a crystal unicorn which rears in a triumphant salute to Hodierna. The fine spray of the fountain glitters as the waters leap high into the sky, splashing down on the crystal and dispersing a cool mist into the quiet night air. Tiny fish dart just under the surface of the pool surrounding the fountain.

Small dwellings cluster about an ivory fountain topped with a crystal unicorn which rears in a triumphant salute to Hodierna. The fine spray of the fountain glitters as the waters leap high into the sky, splashing down on the crystal and shattering the light into thousands of tiny rainbows. Tiny fish dart just under the surface of the pool surrounding the fountain.

node.name: Whitehall Commons, Path of Life
node.description: Majestic oaks stand between the dwellings, their vast boughs spreading above the rooftops like enormous embracing arms. Shadows dapple the benighted path, and occasional rustlings from the branches overhead reveal the roaming of nocturnal wildlife.

Majestic oaks stand between the dwellings, their vast boughs spreading above the rooftops like enormous embracing arms. Tiny birds flit from tree to tree, filling the air with their bright song as they tend their nests in the branches high above. The small grove luxuriates in the sounds of wildlife and a sense of deep calm.

node.name: Whitehall Commons, Way of Peace
node.description: The path is edged on both sides with a low fence fashioned from broken weapons of war. The hafts of shattered swords, dented maces, and snapped staves have been buried in the ground with a thick mahogany rail placed across their tops providing a convenient place to rest. A carved misty-green ignimbrite sundial in the middle of the pathway waits through the night for the coming of sunlight.

The path is edged on both sides with a low fence fashioned from broken weapons of war. The hafts of shattered swords, dented maces, and snapped staves have been buried in the ground with a thick mahogany rail placed across their tops providing a convenient place to rest. A carved misty-green ignimbrite sundial in the middle of the pathway counts through the hours of sunlight.

node.name: Whitehall Commons, Path of Serenity
node.description: Small cottages bordered by neat flower gardens line this stretch of the path. Although the cloud above Stormwill Tower roils in the sky nearby, only a faint, pleasant breeze is present here. Heady floral perfumes, tinged with a hint of spice, fill the air.

node.name: Whitehall Commons, Oak Tree Branch
node.description: The branch has been worn flat on top and the bark smoothed by the countless people who have climbed up to this vantage point. High above, the cloud surrounding Stormwill Tower grumbles and mutters with pent-up lightning, but its violence is overpowered by the certainty of peace in this enclave.

node.name: South Bridge Flats, The Vestibule
node.description: A small vestibule lit by a pewter lamp occupies the space between an ascending flight of stairs and the street door. A wool runner covers the stairs, keeping down both the noise and the dust.

node.name: The Second-Floor Hallway
node.description: A shield-shaped lamp burning a sweetly scented oil lights the upstairs hallway and the stairs to the street level. The drapes on the window match the blue-and-green plaid of the runner on the polished floor.
A trim upstairs hallway is carpeted with a wool runner in green and blue, matching the drapes on the window at the street end of the room. A polished oil lamp shaped like a shield lights the stairs.

node.name: Shoan a Sidelkuloa, Foyer
node.description: The crescent-shaped room soars upward the full height of the theater, to an intricately painted ceiling depicting a clear, starry night sky. Silver gilt molding frames the depiction, matching the columns down the walls and the balusters along the grand staircase. Raw silk panels in a rich ivory hue line the space between the columns. On one side of the staircase, two shorter columns flank an archway leading to the floor seating area, while on the opposite side, a matching pair highlights a passageway.

The crescent-shaped room soars upward the full height of the theater, to an intricately painted ceiling depicting a clear, starry night sky. Silver gilt molding frames the depiction, matching the columns down the walls and the balusters along the grand staircase. Raw silk panels in a rich ivory hue line the space between the columns. On one side of the staircase, two shorter columns flank an archway leading to the floor seating area, while on the opposite side, a matching pair highlights a recessed doorway.

node.name: Shoan a Sidelkuloa, Lounge
node.description: Midnight blue lacquered panels line the walls of the lounge, a polished silverwood bar curving across one corner. Behind the bar, matching silverwood shelves display several bottles of featured wines, served from a silver tray resting on the bar. Bright silver sconces hold crystal shades that reflect their light in a rippling underwater effect. Tables and tall bentwood-backed chairs allow patrons to sit and enjoy their selections before or after performances.

node.name: Shoan a Sidelkuloa, Memories
node.description: Ivory-hued lacquered panels line the walls of the shop, and a glass counter stretches along the length of the room. Silver-gilt racks and silk-lined shelves display collectibles and necessities. Gaethzen globes draped with strings of crystal beading create a softly flickering light to attractively highlight the merchandise.

node.name: Shoan a Sidelkuloa, Mezzanine Landing
node.description: The staircase broadens here to allow theatergoers to pass through the archway to the mezzanine seating without disrupting the flow of those continuing upward to the balcony. Highly polished railings protect against falls while allowing a view of the foyer below, and intricately patterned carpets soften the sounds of footsteps.

node.name: Shoan a Sidelkuloa, Balcony Landing
node.description: The staircase broadens here at the top to allow easy passage through the archway to the balcony and box seating. Highly polished railings protect against falls while allowing a view of the foyer far below, and intricately patterned carpets soften the sounds of footsteps.

node.name: Shoan a Sidelkuloa, Box Seating
node.description: Violet silk draperies cover the interior of the box, and cushioned chairs give comfortable seating from which to watch the performances. Silver sconces shaded with frosted glass give a soft light, and a polished silver gilt railing caps the gently curved front wall.

node.name: Shoan a Sidelkuloa, Mezzanine Seating
node.description: Plush velvet upholstery covers the seats, the top edge of each gilt in silver. At this height, the stage is easily viewable, as is the chandelier hanging from the ceiling over the orchestra section. Overhead, the partial ceiling provided by the balcony section is painted a deep ebon hue, and tiny inset crystal stars display constellations.

node.name: Shoan a Sidelkuloa, Orchestra Seating
node.description: Plush velvet upholstery covers the seats, the top edge of each gilt in silver. The stage is easily viewable from this gently sloping section, allowing a view over any taller theatergoers in front. An elaborate chandelier hangs from the ebon-hued ceiling, in which inset crystal stars display constellations in an intricate depiction of the night sky.

node.name: Shoan a Sidelkuloa, Backstage
node.description: The working heart of the theater, this area is alive with activity during performances as actors and staff rush between the men's and women's dressing rooms to the northwest and southwest and the wing to the southeast. Though sparsely decorated in comparison to the public areas, a few luxuries are available. A small silk-draped niche in one wall bears a statue, and a cart nearby holds tea and light refreshments.

node.name: Shoan a Sidelkuloa, Men's Dressing Room
node.description: Dark silk hangings line the walls, a luxury that serves to dampen noise and provide an atmosphere of calm for those preparing here. Shelves and wardrobes bear costumes for the current production. Mirrors along one wall allow actors to check their appearance before going to the wings. A sign in bold but elegant script hangs on the wall.

node.name: Shoan a Sidelkuloa, Women's Dressing Room
node.description: Rich blue silk hangings line the walls, a luxury that serves to dampen noise and provide an atmosphere of calm for those preparing here. Shelves and wardrobes bear costumes for the current production. Mirrors along one wall allow actors to check their appearance before going to the wings. A sign in bold but elegant script hangs on the wall.

node.name: Shoan a Sidelkuloa, Stage Wing
node.description: A strange calm hangs over the stage wings even during performances, in stark contrast to the activity just a few paces away backstage. Performers and stage hands wait here in silence for cues to enter the stage or change scenes.

node.name: Shoan a Sidelkuloa, Orchestra Pit
node.description: Simple chairs, their legs muffled with thick felt, provide seating for musicians. From here, a conductor can direct both the orchestra and any singers on stage.

node.name: Shoan a Sidelkuloa, Stage
node.description: A row of lights illuminates the boards and those who take their place upon them. Dark curtains block sight of the wings.

node.name: Shoan a Sidelkuloa, Understage
node.description: Here in the underbelly of the theater, items are all but abandoned -- damaged or worn beyond easy repair, awaiting eventual disposal or perhaps salvage and rebirth as pieces for new props or costumes. A trapdoor leads up to the stage floor for actors entering or exiting through some abyss or Eylhaar's embrace. A noticeable draft passes between the steps and a large brass grate.

node.name: Shoan a Sidelkuloa, Upper Landing
node.description: Sturdy railings provide safety for those passing from the staircase through the door to the theater roof and the outdoor performance area. One newel post has been carved in a depiction of a tower.

node.name: Shoan a Sidelkuloa, Outdoor Stage
node.description: The simple stage consists of a raised platform of wood planks. Lanterns provide light for nighttime performances.

node.name: Shard Forging Society, Maker's Mark Shop
node.description: Damp walls of alternating limestone and dolomite do little to shield this entryway from the pounding deep inside the forge. A thick oak door leads out onto the streets.

node.name: Shard Forging Society, West Hall
node.description: A pair of diamond-shaped windows clouded entirely by soot, face the city streets. An occasional bang from the crafting rooms sets them rattling in their frames and tosses up small clouds of grey dust.

node.name: Shard Forging Society, East Hall
node.description: This long corridor lined with soot-stained carpet reverberates with the whine of grinding steel. Workers hurry back and forth to resupply at the stand to the northeast.

node.name: Shard Forging Society, Crucible
node.description: A small chimney high above in the ceiling is unable to remove all the smoke from a large fire burning under a granite crucible here. The brown haze swirls about as air currents shift, and adds a bitter taste to the air. A nearby pile of fuel resembles a shadowy beast in the dim torchlight.

node.name: Shard Forging Society, Forge
node.description: Thick grooves in the dolomite floor lead over to a steel anvil and sandstone grindstone that must have seen many dragging trips into and out of the room. A nearby slack tub of discolored water mists into a cloudy haze that further obscures the already smoky air.

node.name: Shard Forging Society, Book Stand
node.description: From an assortment of manuals and books sold here, instructors walk about tutoring crafters in the way of forging. An occasional disagreement between smiths over nomenclature and the finer points of metallurgy add to noise from the ever-present beating of the forges.

node.name: Shard Forging Society, West Hall
node.description: The maple walls in this section of the forge are cleaner than the stone found elsewhere. A thick coat of fire-resistant lacquer amplifies light cast off by the forge fires in the nearby crafting rooms.

node.name: Shard Forging Society, Crucible
node.description: Billows of smoke rise up from a large fire and are sucked through a brick chimney situated high above the work area. A granite crucible towers over the glowing coals, its smooth sides marred by driblets of solidified metal. A wooden slat stacked with a pile of fuel is nearby.

node.name: Shard Forging Society, Forge
node.description: Sparkles from long-dried metal reflect up from the dolomite floor, illuminated by an octagonal forge in the room's center. Nearby, a steel anvil and a granite grindstone wait for use with metalwork. Tendrils of steam rise from the damp floor beneath a briny slack tub used for cooling finished goods.

node.name: Shard Forging Society, Tool Stand
node.description: A circular counter encompasses a pile of wicker baskets bulging with forging tools. Attendants tend to the merchandise and help crafters with orders. The sharp scent of metalworking oil hangs in the air as a contrast to the bitter smoke found elsewhere.

node.name: Shard Forging Society, Office
node.description: Matching suits of full plate armor stand on opposite ends of the room with flamberges clenched within their gauntlets. Overhead, a massive chandelier casts down a dim light that reveals several racks of fine weapons awaiting inspection from the Society Master. A tidy oak desk trimmed with niello occupies what little space remains, near the back wall.

node.name: Shard Forging Society, East Hall
node.description: A pair of water barrels awaits use if the forge fires should get out of control. A thin film of white dust coats the floor and walls, likely caused from the continuous passage of heavy sleds bearing supplies to and from the forges.

node.name: Shard Forging Society, Crucible
node.description: Crinkled patches of metal stain the dolomite floor. The splattering becomes more numerous and expands to form concentric circles near the room's center, where a large granite crucible hangs over a large fire.

node.name: Shard Forging Society, Forge
node.description: An octagonal forge situated in the room's center emits a ruddy glow illuminating the basalt blocks framing it. In the corner, a large grindstone casts a gigantic shadow upon the wall, and wisps of steam rise up from the recently used slack tub and anvil.

node.name: Shard Forging Society, Supply Stand
node.description: Enormous piles of ore flanked by glistening ingots dwarf the crafters making purchases here. Rope as thick as a Gor'Tog's waist hang from a trio of massive pulleys used to rearrange crates around the area.

node.name: Shard Forging Society, Crucible
node.description: A central cavity splits the ceiling and metal tubing funnels smoke away from the glowing fire. A granite crucible scarred with use rests atop a forked beam next to the fire. Black scrapes along the ground lead over to a circular pile of fuel in the corner.

node.name: Shard Forging Society, Forge
node.description: Blocks of carved basalt form an octagonal forge surrounding shallow pits containing piles of fuel. A steel anvil butts up against, and peeks over the heavily chipped blocks. An assortment of metal molds and attachments for the anvil hang from the wall.

node.name: Shard Forging Society, Depot
node.description: Dozens of wooden sleds and carts line the walls next to the supply depot. Well-muscled men arranged into an assembly line haul goods back and forth, while a steady stream of crafters challenges their ability to keep up.

node.name: Shard, Under the Bridge of Rooks
node.description: High in a corner where the support meets the roadway, a large bird's nest dangles bits of straw and string that sway when touched by a breeze. The deck above casts a dark shadow on the water as it ripples past carrying bits of debris that swirl around the center pilings. Jutting from the arch's footing is a large pipe installed as an air vent that plunges deep beneath the ground to the span's underpinnings.

node.name: In the Vent
node.description: This enormous oval of forged metal not only descends at a steep incline, but is slippery and noisily amplifies the echoes from any sound. A small stream of moisture dribbles along in a desultory manner at the base of the curving floor. Rust patterns on the walls form abstract works of natural art.

node.name: In the Vent
node.description: Sounds from above mingle with those from below, creating a murmuring echo that is indecipherable. A few stray leaves adhere to the wall where receding water left them plastered. Underfoot, bits and pieces of debris crumble and mingle with the rivulet in the center, muddying the clarity of the stream.

node.name: In the Vent
node.description: A small stream of moisture dribbles along in a desultory manner at the base of the curving floor. Rust patterns on the walls form abstract works of natural art. Branching off of the pipe is a large opening that leads east.

node.name: In the Vent
node.description: The further one descends, the cooler it becomes. The mix of moisture on the floor with the chilled air creates lace like patterns on the metal walls. The flow of air vacillates between drifting lazily upward and blowing past as it heads down the vent.

node.name: In the Vent
node.description: It is definitely damper here than the small trickle drizzling along underfoot would indicate. Peaks and valleys of rust patterns on the walls form abstract mountain ranges some of which soar high overhead. One side of this pipe appears to have been gouged from behind with enough persistence to open an irregular hole half way up the curve.

node.name: In the Vent
node.description: The pipe ends abruptly, having met the bridge's main support which is encircled by shallow water. This vent was installed in an attempt to draw excess moisture to the surface, but its success is questionable as rust has leached into the stagnant water and at a minimum discolored the column.

node.name: Golden Phoenix, Corridor
node.description: A quiet passage lined with plush gold-edged maroon carpeting and polished rosewood paneling runs along the back of the inn. Trophies from hunting expeditions hang upon the walls -- a snarling snowbeast captured in a lifelike pose, and a buffalo head looming over those who pass through the corridor. Unlike the upstairs rooms, these apartments are owned by their residents, local citizens who prefer the convenience of life at the inn.

node.name: Golden Phoenix, Corridor
node.description: Carved mahogany moldings run the length of the hallway, the dark wood contrasting with the polished rosewood paneling on the walls. The head and claws of a black leucro are mounted upon a wooden shield on the wall, the green glass eyes balefully surveying all who pass beneath its stretch of hall. On the opposite wall, a hunting scene is mounted in a gilded frame.

node.name: Golden Phoenix, Corridor
node.description: The corridor bends to the northeast past the majestic figure of a desumos. A triumph of the taxidermist's art, the golden mane and tawny pelt maintain their original sheen, while the glittering blue glass eyes and ivory fangs add to the realism. Residents have donated crested wooden shields which hang upon rich silk banners along the walls.

node.name: Golden Phoenix, Corridor
node.description: A golden sunburst is inlaid into the rosewood paneling at the end of the hallway. Carved within the sunburst is the image of a phoenix rising from the flames, its wings outstretched toward the sky. The soft gleam of the gold is reflected in the rosewood walls. In the corner, a brass pot holds an oversized fern. The feathery fronds tumble over the sides of the pot to gently brush the deep maroon carpet.

node.name: An Enclosed Courtyard
node.description: Surrounded by lush ferns, an expansive flagstone patio supports several smokewood benches and a small table of refreshments. Vibrant crimson blossoms spangle the clematis vines that cover the trunks of a pair of dwarf maple trees standing guard at the courtyard's archway. Glowing gaethzen orbs are tucked neatly within the fragrant lavender bushes that line the surrounding fence.

node.name: Houses Consulate, Second Floor Foyer
node.description: Dominated by a burgundy rug embroidered with a sprawling shesegri design, the room is delicately scented by an array of colorful native flowers in a large clay pot. A polished ironwood table sits between curving stairways covered with deep red runners. Several large windows facing the street have been left slightly open, allowing in a tranquil breeze.

node.name: Houses Consulate, Floating Reed
node.description: Spread across the room, a fragrant woven reed mat is heaped with odds and ends -- couches, tables piled with books, instruments, a small sink. A wide variety of people travel in and out of the room, busy at all hours.

node.name: Houses Consulate, Rowan Branch
node.description: Plush silk pillows dyed a deep purple sit before a statue of Eluned, a golden shesegri pattern at her feet as an aid in meditation. The thin fog of incense issuing from several golden censers fills the room with the heavy fragrance of jasmine and nearly obscures the lone scribe working at a desk in the corner, his notes illegible to all but himself.

node.name: Houses Consulate, Silk Strings
node.description: Small groups of Elotheans huddle around dark oblong tables, deeply engrossed in the unfurled song scrolls which cover the surfaces. An assortment of refreshments is on a squat oak table near the entrance of the chamber, very close to a lavishly dressed minstrel strumming her mandolin. Her songs of war, peace, and heartbreak are improvised into one continuous song, interrupted only when she pauses to write down a word or two that pleases her.

node.name: Houses Consulate, Third Floor Foyer
node.description: Rich blue rugs have been laid over the cool granite floor, and the foyer's large glass windows reveal a view of the rich countryside south of Shard. Stoic guards stand near the ascending stairway, weapons discreetly at the ready.

node.name: Houses Consulate, Ivory Scroll
node.description: Meticulously cataloged scrolls have been stored in several compartmentalized shelving units along the walls of the room, some full of scrolls while others seem to be missing quite a few. A large table sits in the center of the room, flanked by tall chairs padded with red velvet.

node.name: Houses Consulate, Gilded Longleaf
node.description: Bedrolls in varying stages of occupation lie strewn about the room, and supplies are piled throughout the room. Along one wall, a large map of Ilithi is covered with small round markers, perhaps to help plot the next location of the wandering House.

node.name: Houses Consulate, Waxen Moons
node.description: Curiously empty, the only thing of notice in this room is the banner which hangs in it.

node.name: Houses Consulate, Grey Storm
node.description: The strong scent of ozone fills the room, apparently unnoticed by the mages sorting through the remains of the House lore. Piles of spell scrolls are heaped onto tables, and nearby several large wooden crates hold various talismans and unlabelled bottles of some cloudy liquid. The occasional crow or owl flies into the room through the open window, depositing more onto the piles.

node.name: Houses Consulate, Gentle Lion
node.description: Shining armor hung on hooks near the entrance belongs to the hardworking paladins reviewing religious texts, inventory lists, and planning the rebuilding of their House. Cramped tables cluster near a raised pedestal which holds a timeworn book of laws securely locked in a glass case.

node.name: Houses Consulate, Fourth Floor Foyer
node.description: Covering most of the northern wall, a massive scroll reaches skyward, its pale tan surface covered with countless names. High above, several mosaic stained glass skylights have been carefully disguised among the vivid paintings of cathedral ceiling, bathing the area in a rainbow of color. From behind a simple pine desk, a frazzled clerk copies various records to a thick black book placed on the desk before him.

Covering most of the northern wall, a massive scroll reaches skyward, its pale tan surface covered with countless names. High above, several mosaic stained glass skylights have been carefully disguised among the vivid paintings of the cathedral ceiling. From behind a simple pine desk, a frazzled clerk copies various records to a thick black book placed on the desk before her.

node.name: Houses Consulate, Butterfly Garden
node.description: Exotic plants line the glass walls from floor to ceiling, and make this room feel more like a rainforest than a consulate in Shard. Multihued butterflies glide to and fro over the dew-soaked petals of the thriving flora, just as content to perch on a leaf as on a visitor's finger. In the center of the room is a small sitting area comprised of a metal table with a blue-green glass top and a few chairs. In one corner is a man-made waterfall, the gentle flow of its water cascading over heated stones.

node.name: House of the Silver Star, Hall
node.description: Arching high overhead, the vaulted ceiling of the main hall glitters with a thousand crystal stars. Glowing spheres tinted the many colors of the heavens float in myriad constellations, slowly turning about in a celestial dance. Arches to the east and west open up into spacious meeting rooms, a midnight blue runner between them.

node.name: House of the Silver Star, Meeting Room
node.description: Prominently placed on a raised dais, a black marble podium gleams in the soft light of the ornate crystal candelabra overhead. Far dimmer light emanates from stained glass sconces along the walls, illuminating the clusters of low brocade silk couches which ring the room while keeping the main focus towards the center.

node.name: House of the Silver Star, Feasterie
node.description: A stately piano sits at the ready near one of the the rich red brocade curtains, an elaborate golden candelabra atop it. An enormous silk-draped table piled high with food and drink takes up most of the space in this room, a dark ferishanloa chair at each silver-edged place setting. Underfoot is a heavy rug of indigo silk, silver-dipped threads running through it to sparkle in the candlelight.

node.name: House of the Silver Star, Den
node.description: Burning low and surrounded by plush brocade silk couches, the brushed bronze brazier in the center of the room is a social meeting point for those who spend time relaxing and studying in the House proper. Here mages gather for casual conversation, the tall skylight above providing a view of the heavens at all times.

node.name: House of the Silver Star, Library
node.description: Smelling strongly of parchment and ink, this room's dry atmosphere is ideal for the keeping of the House's scrolls. Heavy wooden bookshelves line the room, though one wall is entirely taken up by a large bay window overlooking the front lawn.

node.name: House of the Silver Star, Study Area
node.description: Fine parchment charts of each of the main constellations cover the matte black walls, the creamy hue of the star charts stark against them. Dark mahogany desks are positioned facing the walls, each stocked with carved seaglass inkwells filled with rich blue ink and stoppered with chunks of rosy wax.

node.name: House of the Silver Star, Mystic Corner
node.description: Sheer jewel-toned silks drape over the walls of the room, sunlight filtering in just enough to illuminate the room with a hazy red glow. Dark, gnarled shelves are covered with bottles and jars of unidentifiable substances behind a partially open crystal-beaded curtain. Low to the floor is a round table of some sort of rough stone with deep red crystalline veins. A rich red brocade silk cushion supports a large crystal ball atop the pillow-ringed table.

node.name: House of the Silver Star, Children's Area
node.description: Brightly colored rugs depicting panther cubs at play enclose this cozy room. Fluffy cushions are thrown about, ready to provide a soft landing spot for a child's bottom. Stacks of picture books illustrating some of the more exciting adventures of the gods litter small low tables, and the walls and ceiling appear to have been decorated by the hands of a child -- sloppy fingerpainted comets adorn a starry sky.

node.name: House of the Silver Star, Stairwell
node.description: Hooks are affixed to one wall at the top of the stairwell, ready to hold the cloaks and umbrellas that might be necessary on the rooftop observatory depending on the weather. A woven reed mat sits just inside the door to the roof. On the floor sits a small statue of a shadowling with rough mats for its bat-like wings provided to scrape the soles of muddy boots.

node.name: House of the Silver Star, Rooftop
node.description: Thick stone blocks form the roof of the House atop which a gleaming silver telescope rises like a spire. Numerous runes are carved into it, though many are scratched and damaged beyond recognition. A hefty brushed steel kettle of hot cocoa dangles above a wide granite firepit within quick reach, ready to warm even the coldest late-night stargazer.

node.name: House of the Silver Star, Lower Level
node.description: Thick rugs cover the cool stone floor underfoot, muffling the sound of footfalls. The ceilings are uncharacteristically low here, though the decor is as luxurious and mystical as the rest of the House. Richly woven tapestries, many of Shard in its infancy, adorn the close walls.

node.name: House of the Silver Star, Water Closet
node.description: Dozens of twisting bronze pipes are attached to one another at odd angles in a bizarre form of engineering. At the foot of the conglomeration of piping is a small burnished chamber pot etched with a blossoming rosebud. Near the door is a small marble stand on which are a bronze washbasin and a pink bar of soap.

node.name: House of the Silver Star, Beneath the Willow Tree
node.description: Long branches trail nearly to the ground around a majestic weeping willow tree, some dipping the tips of their leaves into the clear pond nearby. The willow's broad trunk disappears above into a dense tangle of fragrant leaves that rustle softly in even the slightest breeze.

node.name: House of the Silver Star, Atop the Willow Tree
node.description: High in the willow's branches is a smooth wooden platform with an unobstructed view of the daytime sky. A downward glance reveals the bustling city of Shard, the din a faint buzz from here. Towards the northwest, the massive black marble building which is home to the House of the Silver Star stands proudly, its facade as impenetrable as the secrets within.

High in the willow's branches is a smooth wooden platform with an unobstructed view of the nighttime sky. Towards the northwest, the massive black marble building which is home to the House of the Silver Star stands proudly, little visible through its drawn curtains. A downward glance reveals the city of Shard, illuminated with thousands of lights cut through by the pools of darkness where the rivers lie.

node.name: Shard Alchemy Society, Entrance
node.description: An austere lobby carved from solid granite supports the tower above. Alchemists continually line the stairs leading up, waiting to claim a good spot at the crafting stations. The sound of shuffling feet and disagreements over seasonal pricing can be heard from the floor above.

node.name: Shard Alchemy Society, Alchemical Materials
node.description: Softly glowing gaethzen spheres hang over glass-lidded pine cases that display a variety of materials for sale. A dark wool carpet depicting a cornucopia of alchemical ingredients covers the floor, ready to mask any possible stains from careless hands.

node.name: Shard Alchemy Society, Books
node.description: Stained-glass windows depicting a menagerie of alchemists in various stages of the craft surround the top of the granite-walled tower. A young Human keeps herself busy by collecting the piles into neat stacks, only to frown and readjust them into an alternate arrangement.

node.name: Shard Alchemy Society, Alchemical Tools
node.description: A bored-looking Elven boy sits next to a steel cabinet in this tight alcove. He occasionally opens one of the various drawers to dust the tools within, keeping them in pristine condition until sold.

node.name: Shard Alchemy Society, Maker's Marks
node.description: A pair of apprentice alchemists scrub the soot-streaked walls of this alchemical proving ground where local residents confirm their worth for the Ilithi Alchemical Society chapter. A pinch-nosed Elothean holding a ledger grumbles behind a paperwork-laden desk, furiously scribbling notes on the latest batch of goods delivered by both hopeful prospects and the well-established champions of the arts.

node.name: Shard Alchemy Society, Work Room
node.description: A fresh breeze flows through two high-cut windows and removes the musty smell of prepared herbs. Three large stone wheels capable of grinding alchemical herbs and plants dominate one side of the room. Along the other side several stoves equipped with flat-iron tops wait for crafters to dry things with them.

node.name: Triage Building
node.description: A pervading sense of orderliness rests within the expansive single-room building. The open floor plan is sectioned off into easily recognizable areas outfitted for distinct purposes. To the east wall rests a large medicinal cabinet and a stack of pallets. Several padded benches line the walls near the entrance and an ebony weapons rack appears on the western wall. Towards the back, several pallets are set out for the care of terminal patients and dead bodies.

node.name: Liani's Heaven, Cellar Passage
node.description: Two lanterns provide faint illumination for the tavern's cellar. A long procession of overstocked wine racks, ale barrels, and crockery cabinets lines the mortised stone corridor, interrupted by a series of heavy wooden doors, presumably leading to more storage areas.

node.name: Liani's Heaven, The Back Bar
node.description: A holdover from a time when wearing the symbol of the Bard's Guild was a death sentence and secrecy was necessary, this quiet wine cellar has once again been cleared out to provide a sanctuary from those hiding from the perils of politics or the hazards of a satirical verse. Scrolls are laid out on the table, the elegant mark of a skilled calligrapher across their surface. A polished maple door leads into a private conservatory set aside for the guild.

node.name: Liani's Heaven, Bards' Room
node.description: Comfortable couches of various sizes and states of repair are pushed into no discernible order in this small but cozy room. Kept at a moderate temperature and serviced by a waitress who stops in from time to time to take orders, the room is a little piece of peace created so that bards may meet in secret and discuss their hopes and dreams in safety, sheltered from the chaos running so rampant in the outside world.

node.name: Liani's Heaven, Bards' Repose
node.description: A warm fire in the fireplace greets provides a cheery centerpiece for a room obviously designed with quiet comfort in mind. Tapestries on the walls muffle the sounds from elsewhere in the cellar, while needlepoint rugs covering the flagstones underfoot provide a soft cushion to travelers seeking a moment of repose. Scattered about the floor, plush pillows allow seating to be easily adjusted to fit large meetings as easily as small groups of bards discussing their next performance.

node.name: Shard Engineering Society, Depot
node.description: An assortment of supply-laden wagons and carts rumble in through an enormous diamondique arch. Vendors peddle supplies to eager crafters all throughout the entryway. Nearby a gate leads to the inner rooms, and some thick oak doors lead to more shops.

node.name: Shard Engineering Society, Workroom
node.description: At one end of the room stands a work bench covered with tools. Deep grooves and scratches cover the bench's oak surface. Wood shavings and stone bits dot the rough granite floor below.

node.name: Shard Engineering Society, Workroom
node.description: At one end of the room stands a work bench covered with tools. Deep grooves and scratches cover the bench's oak surface. Wood shavings and stone bits dot the rough granite floor below.

node.name: Shard Engineering Society, Workroom
node.description: At one end of the room stands a work bench covered with tools. Deep grooves and scratches cover the bench's oak surface. Wood shavings and stone bits dot the rough granite floor below.

node.name: Shard Engineering Society, Workroom
node.description: At one end of the room stands a work bench covered with tools. Deep grooves and scratches cover the bench's oak surface. Wood shavings and stone bits dot the rough granite floor below.

node.name: Shard Engineering Society, Walkway
node.description: A suspended wooden walkway connects both halves of the Engineering Society. Below, a statue garden demonstrates the very best works of art from local crafters.

node.name: Shard Engineering Society, Bookstore
node.description: Cluttered stacks of books completely fill a recessed pit in the corner. Book sellers for the Society shrug to confused patrons, seemingly unapologetic regarding the mess. One neat and organized table of books stands out from the rest.

node.name: Shard Engineering Society, Tool Store
node.description: Tools hang from corkboard decorating this long, rectangular room. A thick sent of oil clings to the air and the scraping sound of stone sharpening metal drones on in the background. Some nearby salespeople wait to help customers.

node.name: Shard Outfitting Society, Main Entrance
node.description: Enveloped in dark pink granite walls, the main entrance exudes a warmth of colors from the parquet bloodwood flooring to the multitude tapestries hanging from the ceiling. Mannequins in one corner display a few of the masterpieces made by Ilithi's more promising tailors while display cases filled with jewelry items occupy another. Overhead, a prestige board hangs from the intricately carved ceiling beams to display the names of the most dedicated to each outfitting discipline throughout each of the provinces.

node.name: Shard Outfitting Society, Book Store
node.description: The scent of tanning lotions lingers in the air from the hides covering the walls. An overworked Elven fellow sits behind a small table scraping away at some leather that he pulls from the large pile on the table. Several tall racks against a wall hold a plentiful supply of crafting books.

node.name: Shard Outfitting Society, Hallway
node.description: Pine paneled walls are nearly covered by racks of raw cloth and leather that flank either side of the narrow hallway. In one corner sits a mannequin completely destitute of any type of clothing. Tailors of all kinds rush back and forth, busy with their wares, dropping a random pin on the floor adding to the collection of scrap.

node.name: Shard Outfitting Society, Main Office
node.description: Two clerks sit behind the counter taking orders and sorting through the day's various requisitions. A pile of invoices and work orders are stacked high on the Society Master's desk in the rear of the office next to a tall book shelf.

node.name: Shard Outfitting Society, Tool Shop
node.description: The supply shop projects an air of quiet efficiency at all times with clerks refilling the various empty slots with new tools for sale. Bottles, fabrics, and canvases stand neatly arranged on shelves that line the wall behind a polished white granite counter. Several workrooms nearby provide enough static noise to block out the clerks idle conversations.

node.name: Shard Outfitting Society, Material Depot
node.description: Three finely crafted rocking chairs sit around a round table in the center of the room where denizens will often sit and play a quick dice game while working away. Shelves line the room where someone can set aside their work for a moment of rest, although those come few and far between. A counter stocked with many types of fabrics and furs dominates one side of the room to make crafting materials readily accessible.

node.name: Shard Outfitting Society, Hallway
node.description: The hallway comes to an abrupt end where it branches off into to three rooms separated by granite arches. Scrap cloth and leather along with empty bottles litter the otherwise empty tile floor. Busy tailors shuffle in and out of the rooms, avoiding the garbage on the floor, hurrying to get more supplies.

node.name: Shard Outfitting Society, Weaving Room
node.description: Expansive windows open out to the north, giving a humbling view of the Great Tower. Beneath a hefty loom is a lumpy burlap rug showing signs of wear atop a large lump, which props up the rug, from the shoes of many a weaver propping his feet up as he worked. A grey granite arch leads back out into the building.

Darkness pours through the expansive windows as small candles on the sill illuminate the area. Beneath a hefty loom is a lumpy burlap rug showing signs of wear atop a large lump, which props up the rug, from the shoes of many a weaver propping his feet up as he worked. A grey granite arch leads back out into the building.

node.name: Shard Outfitting Society, Weaving Room
node.description: Open prairies and grasslands are painted in a panoramic mural that cover the stone walls from floor to ceiling. Planted pots of junegrass and lilies are set up in a horseshoe around a hefty loom. A beige granite arch leads back out into the building.

node.name: Shard Outfitting Society, Weaving Room
node.description: Small motes of dust drift by calling attention to the light provided by a series of several tiny skylights in the ceiling. Stained glass windows line the wall, providing patches of colored light as the sun shines through to illuminate the hefty loom sitting in the center of the room. A long, thin rug decorated with embroidered sunbursts has a threadbare trail evidently marking where most weavers stand to perform their craft. An azure granite arch leads back out into the building.

Smoke from several sconces lining the room swirl out of the dim skylights overhead, and create a smoky fog along the ceiling. Stained glass windows line the wall, reflecting the warm glow off the colored panes back into the room. A long, thin rug decorated with embroidered sunbursts stretches in front of a hefty loom, a threadbare trail evidently marking where most weavers stand to perform their craft. An azure granite arch leads back out into the building.

node.name: Shard Outfitting Society, Spinning Room
node.description: Alternating panels of ironwood and cedar surround the walls to form stripes of dark and light. Torchlight reflects off the highly polished walls to showcase the large spinning wheel sitting atop a plush cotton rug near the center of the room. Beneath it, the alternating woods come together in a point. The only other piece of furniture to grace the room is a long workbench against the back wall. A green granite arch leads back out into the building.

node.name: Shard Outfitting Society, Spinning Room
node.description: Hundreds of stained glass panels make up the ceiling of this room, filtering the daylight through a myriad of colors. A painted spinning wheel sits below the colored skylight atop a rug dyed in vibrant greens and blues. The workbench lining the back wall is splattered with various colored paints to add to the visual effect. A white granite arch leads back out into the building.

node.name: Shard Outfitting Society, Spinning Room
node.description: Large panes of thick, frosted glass make up the ceiling of this room, letting the daylight filter through to provide ambient flood lighting. A large spinning wheel sits below the skylight atop an intricate grass rug woven in a zig-zag pattern. The workbench lining the back wall generally serves as a place to take a quick respite or work on a project that requires more attention to detail. A puce granite arch leads back out into the building.

node.name: Milene's Rose, Private Booth
